programme.desc: Now an ambitious young man making a name for himself in London, David returns to Suffolk with his schoolfriend Steerpike in tow to catch up with Peggoty, his late mother's maid. Adaptation of the Dickens classic, starring Pauline Quirke and Ciaran McMenamin

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: Micawber threatens to expose Uriah Heep for the devious character that he is, and David returns to Canterbury once again. Adaptation of the Dickens classic with an all-star cast, including Pauline Quirke, Maggie Smith, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Bob Hoskins

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Tilly Trotter
programme.desc: Period drama about a 19-year-old woman, who is attacked after an engagement party in honour of a farmer for whom she has feelings. Carli Norris stars

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Controversial plans are afoot to introduce a private clinic to Nonnatus House. The proposition leads to the first disagreement in 20 years between Sister Julienne, who sees the potential to generate income, and Dr Turner, who opposes private healthcare on principle. Shelagh feels caught in the middle of their conflict, while Trixie is delighted by the opportunity of working at the new clinic. Sister Monica Joan's crisis of faith continues to trouble her, a baby is born with no legs below the knees, and Lucille helps Cyril find the perfect accommodation that will benefit him and the Church

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Alan Davies' consulting detective returns to pit his inquiring mind against another festive mystery. According to a local legend, the house known as Daemons' Roost was once home to Jacob Surtees, a 19th-century sorcerer thought to have summoned the powers of Hell to terrorise and subjugate visitors. Now, it is home to Nathan Clore, an ailing film director with a dark secret, who has summoned his step-daughter Alison back home to impart to her the chilling truth of what happened to her mother and sister, who died in mysterious circumstances when she was just a child. However, mere days before Alison arrives, Nathan suffers a debilitating stroke, leaving him unable to shed any further light on the matter. Determined to get to the bottom of the mystery, Alison calls in old acquaintance Jonathan Creek to help. Also starring Sarah Alexander, Warwick Davis, Emun Elliott and Ken Bones

programme.title: Death in Holy Orders
programme.desc: Conclusion. The death count at St Anselm's theological college continues to mount, leaving the school threatened with closure, but its members close ranks as detective Adam Dalgliesh's investigations uncover a web of intrigue. Thriller based on PD James's book, starring Martin Shaw, with Robert Hardy, Janie Dee and Jesse Spencer

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: First episode of the Glasgow-set crime drama. A murderer is on the loose, and one by one, bodies of young women are found strangled in the city. The inquiry is headed by top detective Jim Taggart, a tough local cop who has risen through the ranks and one of the new breed of graduate policemen, Peter Livingstone. However, despite their differences they work together breaking all the rules to hunt the killer before he strikes again. Mark McManus and Neil Duncan star

programme.desc: Snowdon, or Yr Wyddfa, is the most popular mountain in Britain, attracting three-quarters of a million visitors each year - and it only getting busier. This documentary follows the work that goes in to keeping the tourists happy, including the maintenance of the five-mile mountain railway, which not only carries visitors but also supplies to the shop and cafe and even water and waste to and from the toilets. Meanwhile, wardens patrol the mountain to ensure the safety of walkers, and volunteers spends their weekends collecting tons of discarded rubbish

The Swiss progressed to the knockout stage after topping Group A with a record of one win and two draws from their three matches, while Spain could only finish second in Group C despite winning twice and drawing once in their three games

Finally, Nadiya shares her recipe for chocolate-dipped florentines

Five-time world champion Rachel Atherton will be hoping to recapture a title she last won in 2018, while fellow Briton Tahnee Seagrave has twice won silver medals in the event. Valentina Holl is the defending champion, having become the first Austrian downhill winner last year

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max returns to the ED to treat a mother and son involved in a car accident. He is thrown back into working alongside Jodie, while the patients' history brings back old memories. Paige is forced to face her feelings despite using work as a distraction, and Donna struggles to move on from her recent trauma

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: Beres, Aria and Vita travel to Jamaica for a family funeral, where the story of Aria's short-lived musical career comes to light - but Vita refuses to be scared off by her mother's bad experiences. Beres is furious to discover that he has been left nothing in the will, but his outburst leads Ara to a horrifying realisation about the man her husband claims is his younger brother

programme.title: When Harry Met Sally (1989)
programme.desc: A man and a woman with different attitudes to life meet by chance and develop a close and long-lasting friendship. But over time, a mutual sexual attraction begins to develop and threatens to ruin their relationship - raising the question whether men and women can ever really be just friends. Romantic comedy, starring Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan

programme.title: Eighth Grade (2018)
programme.desc: Introverted 13-year-old Kayla Day is finishing her final week at a New York public school. She posts motivational online videos on about confidence and self-image that get few views, Meanwhile, Mark, her single father, struggles to connect with her and break Kayla's reliance on social media. Writer/director Bo Burnham's critically acclaimed comedy drama, starring Elsie Fisher, Josh Hamilton and Emily Robinson

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Netherlands v South Africa (Kick-off 3.00am). Coverage of the third last-16 match, which takes place at Sydney Football Stadium in Australia. The Dutch topped Group E after claiming victories over Portugal and Vietnam, either side of a draw against reigning champions USA, while South Africa progressed to the knockout stage after one win, one draw and one loss in Group G, against Italy, Argentina and Sweden, respectively

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Documentary following gay Christian couple Grace and Jess as they prepare to move into their first home together, a canal boat, leaving behind the family, friends and church community that refuse to accept them. They hope that once they are settled, they can find a new church and community that welcomes them

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits St Barts in London, the UK's oldest hospital, to discover how it began as a monastery after a vision from God, and finds out how faith is still at work today. Plus, Laura Wright meets two sisters in Birmingham with a love of singing who were the first conjoined twins in the UK to undergo a life-saving procedure

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore enlists Daniel Heath to give new life to a retro bureau picked up from Woking Recycling Centre. For her own project, Sarah has three wooden doors to get creative with

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Coverage of the men's road race on day four of the Championship, which consists of a 170-mile route from Edinburgh to Glasgow. Since Tom Simpson became the first in 1965, only one other Briton has claimed the coveted rainbow jersey in this event - Mark Cavendish in 2011. Rising Belgian star Remco Evenepoel took victory at last year's race, powering away from his rivals during the closing stages. France's Christophe Laporte secured silver, and Australian Michael Matthews took bronze

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A dog-friendly garden is a top priority today for Nicki Chapman's buyer in Devon, who has £350,000 to spend on a new home for her and her much-loved pet pooch

programme.title: Ghostbusters (1984)
programme.desc: Three eccentric scientists put their hi-tech gadgetry and knowledge of the paranormal to money-making use by setting up in business as freelance ghost catchers. A musician calls them in to investigate when she sees strange creatures in her kitchen, only to end up possessed. As the spook-hunting team members deal with an attempt to shut their operation down, they discover an evil demonic entity is being summoned into existence and it falls to them to stop this creature from destroying the world. Supernatural comedy adventure, starring Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, Sigourney Weaver, Ernie Hudson and Rick Moranis

Matt discovers how Dumfries House is providing local people with ways to improve mental and physical wellbeing and joins a tea dance. Charlotte visits a craft workshop to try her hand at stained glass window making, and hears about plans to re-use, refurbish and re-engineer turbines

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the grounds of Wollaton Hall in Nottingham, where treasures include a fire extinguisher cocktail shaker, a toy monkey popping out of a musical pineapple, and underwear belonging to Queen Victoria. Fiona also learns about local activist George Powe, who campaigned to secure employment opportunities for black workers at Raleigh in the 1950s, and guesses the value of three cameo items

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: Kasia takes on her first assignment as an agent - shadowing a Polish woman working in an aircraft factory in Manchester who is suspected of sending information to the Nazis. Rajib's military values are tested when he learns his men are receiving worse rations than their allies, and he is torn between duty and ideal. Meanwhile, a familiar face comes to David's aid

programme.title: The King's Speech (2010)
programme.desc: The younger son of George V struggles to cope with an uncontrollable stammer, prompting his wife to enlist the aid of an eccentric Australian speech therapist. The support and friendship of the doctor prove invaluable when a crisis places the repressed prince on the throne, just as the outbreak of the Second World War leaves the country in need of a strong king. Oscar-winning fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter and Guy Pearce

Tommy Walsh is in Verney Junction, Buckinghamshire to hear about the development plans for a three-bed mid-terraced cottage

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine presents from the Antiques, Vintage and Collectors Fair in Detling, and finds out how retro computers are becoming collectable. With Irita Marriott and Nick Hall

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team reports from the biggest horticultural event in the north - the RHS Flower Show Tatton Park. Joe Swift and Frances Tophill reveal the latest in garden design, as well as bringing plant perfection from some of the best nurseries and growers in the country. Also, Nick Bailey shines a botanical spotlight on begonias, and Toby Buckland visits a Liverpool community who have regenerated their streets through collective gardening

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Seventeen contenders start this edition of the quiz, but how many of them will survive to face the £10,000 Question? Hosted by Rick Edwards

programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of Tchaikovsky, the Evil Dead trilogy, Rafael Nadal, and This Country, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A stone carver, a fine art painter and a heraldic artist pitch ideas for a piece of art to celebrate the 850th anniversary of a Scottish castle. Hosted by Nick Knowles

programme.title: Netball World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Malawi v Uganda (Centre-pass 3.00pm). Live coverage of the 5th-8th placement semi-final play-off match, held at Cape Town International Convention Centre in South Africa

programme.title: Beechgrove Repotted
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes tours of some of Scotland's best-loved public gardens, including the Royal Botanic Gardens Edinburgh, Scone Palace's hedge maze and Branklyn Gardens

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Compilation edition revisiting some of the historic venues from the series and offering some new valuations and unexpected auctions. Paul Martin visits Rodmarton Manor, an extraordinary Arts and Crafts house in the Cotswolds

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents coverage of day two of the annual World Track Championships, which takes place this year at the Sir Chris Hoy Velodrome in Glasgow. The Great Britain quartet of Ethan Hayter, Oliver Wood, Ethan Vernon and Daniel Bigham won team pursuit gold in the corresponding session of last year's event in France

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson unearths the Suffolk village of Orford's history of defending the British Isles, and uncovers a local legend involving smugglers and the local pub

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: George Anderson and Carole Baxter harvest the first of this year's potato crop and also pick blackcurrants and gooseberries as well as giving an update on summer lawn care. There is a visit to a garden in Glasgow designed to assist people who have spinal injuries, while Brian Cunningham looks at ways to control pests and gets ready for some tree planting

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team celebrates people who are growing their own, from vegetables to flowers across the UK. At Longmeadow, Monty Don shares tips and advice on how to get the most out of the bargain plants available at this time of year. Joe Swift visits a community food-growing project in Bristol. And Rachel de Thame meets a cut flower-grower who started her own flower farm with no prior knowledge of growing

programme.title: Reframed: Marilyn Monroe
programme.desc: Marilyn is forging a new identity for herself in New York, but when news breaks that she plans to create her own production company, Darryl Zanuck refuses to let her out of her contract. Narrated by Jessica Chastain

programme.title: Reframed: Marilyn Monroe
programme.desc: In the final part of the series, Marilyn triumphs in her most celebrated comedy yet, Some Like It Hot. In the weeks before her death, she is on the cusp of a new and exciting future, making front pages with her portraits, and securing a triumphant new deal with 20th Century Fox. Narrated by Jessica Chastain

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: The chef continues his deep dive into the industry he knows and loves. This time, he meets brave and ambitious entrepreneurs looking to expand their businesses in the midst of some of the toughest economic conditions the industry has ever seen. In the high-risk game of hospitality, when do you twist, stick or fold?

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Debra from Wigan, Greater Manchester, wants her new build plot to be transformed into a calming zen garden for relaxation and contemplation. She'd also like it to be low maintenance and maximise the views from the woodland beyond. Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill try to bring her vision to life on a budget of £6,000

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: On a trip to the Peak District, Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr begin take to the water on the River Derwent. Josh and Mark's kayak down the rapids becomes a no-holds-barred race, leaving one triumphant and the other fuming. Mark Sr meanwhile takes a more relaxed journey downstream, taking in the scenery from the comfort of a rubber ring. Next stop is the town of Bakewell, where they sample its famous sweet delicacies. That night they set up camp and as the sun sets, Josh reveals how he's feeling about his footballing career drawing to a close and his fears for the future

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in the North Yorkshire seaside resort of Scarborough to explore one of the greatest royal fortresses in England

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: A misunderstanding sends Nadine into an emotional state. Orna struggles to get Sean to be honest. Deep fissures in Brock and Kristi's relationship emerge

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Natasha reveals her deepest fears. Kristi sheds light on Brock's betrayal. Orna reaches her limit with Sean's gaslighting

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: A Strictly Come Dancing den for ballroom dancer Harry from Dudley

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: When their parents clear out the attic, the siblings compete to have it for their own private bedroom in an epic play-battle saga based on Cheese's medieval fantasy story

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Football freestyle star Harriet Pavlou joins the team in the Blue Peter garden to show off some skills to try at home

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall heads to Ecuador in search of ocean giants and the biggest baby animal on Earth

programme.title: Netball World Cup 2023
programme.desc: England v New Zealand (Centre-pass 10.00am) Live coverage of the first semi-final, held at Cape Town International Convention Centre in South Africa. While England were Commonwealth gold medallists in 2018, they have yet to win a World Cup crown. Four years ago, they suffered heartbreak at this stage of the competition in Liverpool, narrowly losing 47-45 to a New Zealand team who went on to lift the trophy. Presented by Betty Glover, with expert analysis from former England captain Ama Agbeze

programme.title: Caribbean Food Made Easy
programme.desc: Levi Roots cooks hot pepperpot stew with his mother, tries his hand at the art of nouvelle Caribbean cuisine, and surprises a hungry audience of clubbers by serving up kebabs with a tropical twist

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by fellow Michelin-starred chef Daniel Clifford for a discussion on luxury dishes, with the host pitting his coffee choux bun against his guest's smoked haddock with Iberico ham and beurre blanc. Drinks expert Joe Wadsack brings a white rioja and an Australian dessert wine to the table, while Arabella Weir is taught how to make an upmarket treat by a master patissiere and chocolatier

programme.title: Undiscovered Worlds with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve Backshall searches for remains of the Mayan civilisation in the Yucatan, exploring a network of underground caves that were believed to be a supernatural world. The expedition uncovers a flooded cavern filled with the remains of human sacrifice victims, as well as artefacts that reveal a less disturbing side to this ancient culture

programme.title: Animals Unexpected
programme.desc: Biologist Lucy Cooke investigates reports of animals being found in unusual places, often turning up thousands of miles from their natural habitats. She goes on a journey around the world to discover why these creatures have relocated, examining the unusual skills animals use to adapt to new surroundings and how humans have altered the environment, with unforeseen consequences

programme.title: Whisky Galore! (1949)
programme.desc: The residents of a Hebridean island endure many months without alcohol as a result of wartime rationing. When a ship runs aground carrying thousands of cases of Scotch, the locals are determined to keep it to themselves, despite the best efforts of a puritanical English home guard officer to confiscate it. Ealing comedy, starring Basil Radford, Gordon Jackson and James Robertson Justice

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Although barely a foot tall, the honey badger has a reputation as one of the most fearless animals in the world, attacking just about anything from venomous snakes to adult lions. This documentary follows a scientist, a beekeeper and a conservationist in South Africa as they set out to discover if the creature is really as fearsome as it is made out to be

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: A collection of interesting finds from the show, with visits to Margam Country Park in south Wales, Highcliffe Castle in Dorset and Powderham Castle in Devon. Experts Catherine Southon, Philip Serrell, Will Axon, Mark Stacey and Claire Rawle assess items ranging from a signed photo of Elvis to a stick-back chair. Paul Martin also takes a look at the treasures and lavish interiors at Parham House in West Sussex and finds out about the role the house played during the Second World War

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Birmingham Phoenix v Trent Rockets (Start-time 6.00pm). Live coverage of the men's match from Edgbaston, Birmingham. When these teams met last year, star man Alex Hales blasted 58 runs from just 41 balls as the Rockets reached their victory target in style. All-rounder Liam Livingstone top scored for the Phoenix, bludgeoning 47 runs from 28 deliveries

programme.title: Tony Bennett at the London Palladium: BBC Sessions
programme.desc: A 2011 concert in which the American singer marked his 85th birthday by drawing on a repertoire spanning 60 years. Accompanied by his quartet, he performed songs including I Left My Heart in San Francisco, The Good Life, Smile and Steppin' Out with My Baby, as well as duetting with Cleo Laine and Leona Lewis

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Documentary taking a look at the man behind the silky voice as Tony Bennett - civil rights activist, jazz enthusiast, painter and New Yorker - takes a tour around his native city and the world of American music with reporter Reggie Nadelson. Featuring contributions from politician Mario Cuomo, painter David Hockney, songwriter Elvis Costello and jazz musician Wynton Marsalis. First aired in 1996

programme.title: Tony Bennett Sings...
programme.desc: The singer performs a selection of his favourite songs, including I Left My Heart in San Francisco, I Wanna Be Around, For Once in My Life, Fly Me to the Moon and Stranger in Paradise. First aired in 1979

programme.title: Tony Bennett Sings...
programme.desc: The singer performs songs by Duke Ellington, Johnny Mercer and Cole Porter, accompanied by bassist Arthur Watts, drummer Alf Bigden and the Rothstein String Quartet. First aired in 1979

programme.title: BBC Four Sessions
programme.desc: Tony Bennett performs a selection of his best-loved songs at LSO St Luke's, London, in 2007. Including I Left My Heart in San Francisco, The Best Is Yet to Come, All of Me, They Can't Take That Away from Me and The Good Life

programme.title: Luzzu (2021)
programme.desc: A man risks everything to provide for his wife and newborn son by entering Malta's black-market fishing industry. Drama, starring Jesmark Scicluna, Marlene Schranz and David Scicluna. In Maltese and English

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team celebrates people who are growing their own, from vegetables to flowers across the UK. At Longmeadow, Monty Don shares tips and advice on how to get the most out of the bargain plants available at this time of year. Joe Swift visits a community food-growing project in Bristol. And Rachel de Thame meets a cut flower-grower who started her own flower farm with no prior knowledge of growing

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Adam Henson are in the thick of hay-making season, discovering what makes one of the nation's oldest crops so special. Charlotte is put to work on the Lizard Peninsula in Cornwall by a farmer whose family have been making hay for more than 500 years and also gets the chance to see how harvest activity attracts and excites myriad creatures. Adam is at a polo match finding out how nutrients in high-end hay are helping horse owners to get ahead, and Tom Heap investigates how marine heatwaves are threatening the sea life that lives around our coastline

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: George Anderson and Carole Baxter harvest the first of this year's potato crop and also pick blackcurrants and gooseberries as well as giving an update on summer lawn care. There is a visit to a garden in Glasgow designed to assist people who have spinal injuries, while Brian Cunningham looks at ways to control pests and gets ready for some tree planting

programme.title: Life in a Cottage Garden with Carol Klein
programme.desc: During March and April, the horticulturist clears the detritus left behind by winter, as celandines, violets and primroses begin to bloom. She plants the first seeds of the year and is joined by a local gardener to prune the box hedge, but their work is interrupted by a nesting sparrow

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt takes a look back at some of his favourite recipes and best moments from Saturday Kitchen

programme.title: Strawbridge Over the Drawbridge
programme.desc: Ballywalter Chef James Strawbridge visits Lord and Lady Dunleath (Brian and Vibse) at their Ballywalter Park home, hoping to create a menu which both impresses and captures the history and character of the estate. Arriving by air, James receives a warm Ballywalter welcome from the couple who take him on a tour of the estate. James discovers tales from the house's rich past including a cricket team captained by a butler, an unusual collection of birds and a poignant scrapbook created by a mother to depict the tragic tale of her son

programme.title: Pizza Boys
programme.desc: Jez and Ieuz's trip leads them to Naples, the spiritual home of pizza. It's a matter of days before the competition, so they need to focus on tracking down the best ingredients for their pizza. They're also keen to pick up any last minute tips, so they arrange a series of masterclasses with some of the most renowned pizzaiolos in the city

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three new chefs to the competition make their way to the kitchen for the South West heats, preparing their starters and fish courses. Emily Scott creates a salad inspired by musical icon David Bowie for her starter, while Joe Baker opts for an unorthodox pairing of seafood and cheese for his dish. For his fish course, Lee Smith creates a dish featuring turbot and turnip, which he cooks in a variety of ways

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of easy homemade meals to sate cravings for a takeaway, including haddock and chips from James Martin, a pizza recipe from Keith Floyd and butterfly cakes from Mary Berry

programme.title: Pillow Talk (1959)
programme.desc: A man and woman who have never met squabble about each other's use of a shared telephone line. One day their paths cross by chance and he is instantly smitten with her. Quickly realising who she really is, he poses as a perfect gentleman from the South to woo her. Romantic comedy, starring Rock Hudson, Doris Day, Tony Randall, Thelma Ritter, Nick Adams and Julia Meade

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Celia Imrie narrates a look at some of cinema's best-loved partnerships, including Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers, Doris Day and Rock Hudson, Paul Newman and Paul Redford, and Nick Frost and Simon Pegg. Interviews and appearances on the BBC over the years are used to tell the stories of the stars who audiences loved to see up on the big screen together

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Antiques experts James Lewis and Christina Trevanion appraise antiques and collectibles at Birmingham's Museum and Art Gallery, while Paul Martin examines the Staffordshire Hoard

programme.title: Netball World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the gold medal match (Centre-pass 5.00pm), held at Cape Town International Convention Centre in South Africa. New Zealand are the defending world champions, while Australia and Jamaica - the two Commonwealth finalists last year - came into the tournament among the leading medal contenders. Presented by Betty Glover, with expert analysis from former England captain Ama Agbeze

programme.title: What They Really Mean For You
programme.desc: Justin Rowlatt, Michelle Ackerley and Dr Tara Shine investigate the eco-friendly alternatives to oil and gas boilers and if it's possible to build an entirely low-carbon electricity network before the government's net zero target of 2050. Justin explores a futuristic house in Salford that is used to test new heating technologies in extreme conditions. Michelle gets an insight into how heat pumps are installed and the cost of doing so. Tara meets the gas company promoting hydrogen as the solution to home heating and finds out if it is a feasible option

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and new co-presenter Rob Rinder go behind the scenes at some of the most extraordinary hotels around the world. Their first stop is Richard Branson's remote clifftop Kasbah Tamadot in Morocco, where they work alongside the staff to discover the significance of Berber hospitality, food and culture to their guests

programme.title: Crazy Rich Agents: Selling Dream Homes
programme.desc: Five rookie property brokers drawn from all walks of life compete in the world of luxury real estate, with the winner being given the opportunity to work at an agency's headquarters in New York. Aly takes up the challenge and hustles to get a meeting with a multimillionaire developer, who he boldly persuades to let him list a £30 million town-house in Mayfair, while former care worker Georgie is given the task of finding a dream home for an influencer couple

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan spends a week exploring Colombia with a local radio host and journalist, discovering how much of the country's reputation for violence is justified. He investigates a new trend for narcotourism, where visitors seek out places associated with drug lord Pablo Escobar, and finds out how Colombians feel about foreigners' fascination with their nation's most infamous criminal. He also visits a Jesus statue shop, learns to make coffee the traditional way, and discovers a game involving explosions

programme.title: Ali (2001)
programme.desc: Biopic of champion boxer Muhammad Ali, covering events from his 1964 fight with Sonny Liston to his Rumble in the Jungle with George Foreman 10 years later. Along the way, the fighter converts to Islam, maintains a conflicted friendship with Malcolm X and causes controversy with his refusal to fight in the Vietnam War. Directed by Michael Mann and starring Will Smith, Jamie Foxx, Jon Voight and Mario Van Peebles

programme.title: A Life in Ten Pictures
programme.desc: Ten photographs that reveal more about the defining moments in the boxer's remarkable life and career, featuring interviews with those who knew him best - including his daughter Jamillah Ali, journalist Gary Younge and Olympic swimmer Janet Evans. The film follows a young Cassius Clay as he 'shook up the world' in more ways than one, before his controversial name change and membership of the Nation of Islam, all the way through to the lighting of the Olympic flame in Atlanta in 1996

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: Thriller about a detective haunted by his brother's childhood disappearance, who becomes obsessed with the idea that his neighbour may have been responsible. Elsewhere, a family return to their rural Welsh home from London to be confronted with disturbing discoveries that have echoes of an infamous double murder committed in the area - and the possibility that someone intends to re-enact the killings

programme.desc: Grammy award-winning jazz singer Dee Dee Bridgewater joins trumpeter Sean Jones and Carnegie Hall's National Youth Jazz Orchestra, comprising outstanding young musicians from across the USA, as they make their BBC Proms debut. The concert promises big band classics, standards and contemporary works, exploring jazz's influence on hip-hop, R&B and pop. Presented by Clive Myrie

programme.title: Our Coast
programme.desc: Adrian Chiles and Mehreen Baig explore the Co Down coastline between Belfast and Strangford Lough, along the Ards Peninsula. In Belfast, Adrian road-tests the largest hydraulic crane in the world and helps park a 100-metre-long Dutch cargo ship. Mehreen goes kayaking on Strangford Lough to see how the currents of the UK's largest sea inlet is placing the area at the forefront of renewable energy research. Plus, Helen Skelton tests the waters of the North Channel, one of the most dangerous swims in the world, and local comedian Shane Todd visits a long-established bespoke racing-car factory

programme.title: Rome: A History of the Eternal City
programme.desc: Historian Simon Sebag Montefiore uncovers the role of religion in creating and maintaining the power of the city. In the first episode, he explores how every event in ancient Rome revolved around worship and that nothing took place without calling on the Pantheon, the temple to their gods. He also reveals the part played by sacredness and sacrifice in Roman culture

programme.title: Clean Sweep
programme.desc: Shelly is haunted by the past as she tries to maintain her routine. Things only get worse when Lynch's true identity is revealed, leading a UK police officer to reopen a 20-year-old case tied to Shelly and her then-boyfriend. Crime thriller, starring Charlene McKenna

programme.title: Clean Sweep
programme.desc: The investigation continues to build steam in both countries, while Shelly continues to juggle her parenting and other responsibilities. Crime thriller, starring Charlene McKenna

programme.title: Blankety Blank

programme.title: Parkinson

programme.title: Michael Crawford and Michele Dotrice Remember - Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em
programme.desc: It's 50 years since accident-prone Frank Spencer and his long-suffering wife Betty first appeared on the small screen. Here, Michael Crawford and Michele Dotrice - the actors who brought them to life - are reunited to recall their time working on the hit 1970s sitcom. They reveal how they came to be cast, what it was like to film the series and the impact the show's success had on their lives and careers

programme.title: Some Mothers Do 'Ave 'Em

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Another chance to this intimate portrait of an exceptionally gifted musical family in lockdown, the Kanneh-Masons. Ever since lockdown began, the seven young prodigies aged 10 to 24 have been isolated in the family home in Nottingham, along with their parents Stuart and Kadiatu. Unable to perform publicly, the family decided to stage a vibrant and eclectic concert in the only place they can - their own home - and granted the BBC exclusive access using fixed rig cameras installed in the house that were remotely operated

programme.title: Tchaikovsky and Prokofiev at the Proms
programme.desc: Star pianist Isata Kanneh-Mason makes her solo Proms debut with Prokofiev's third piano concerto, with the BBC National Orchestra of Wales. Ryan Bancroft conducts the orchestra as they also take on Tchaikovsky's fifth symphony. Presented by Clive Myrie

programme.title: Tchaikovsky
programme.desc: Charles Hazlewood presents the first in a two-part docu-drama recreating key moments in the life of the Russian composer, and conducts the Mariinsky Young Philharmonic in excerpts from Romeo and Juliet and The Sleeping Beauty. Ed Stoppard stars in the title role, while Alice Glover plays his wife Antonina Milyukova. Performers include Natasha Paremsky, Sasha Sitkovetsky, Irina Matayeva, Uliana Lopatkina and Ilya Kuznetsev

programme.title: Tchaikovsky
programme.desc: The story of the composer's life continues with his disastrous decision to wed Antonina Milyukova and his affair with Joseph Kotek which followed three months later. The programme concludes with his death and the debate concerning whether the cause was cholera or suicide. Charles Hazlewood conducts the Mariinsky Young Philharmonic and the talented Russian Sasha Sitkovetsky performs Tchaikovsky's Violin Concerto. Ed Stoppard and Alice Glover star

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Jacob Bronowski examines how mankind's understanding of mathematics has brought the world closer to understanding the forces of nature. Travelling from the olive groves of Samos to Spain, he gives his own novel proof of Pythagoras's famous theorem, and looks at the interlocking of numbers and nature in the descriptions of musical harmony, early astronomy and perspective in paintings. Originally broadcast in 1973

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: From earliest times, mankind has looked outwards from the Earth and wondered at the movements of sun, stars and planets. Jacob Bronowski traces the attempts to map the forces which move the heavens, beginning in the great stone-age cultures of the Americas. First shown in 1973

programme.desc: It’s not every day that you dig up an old wooden chest on the beach, even if you’re super treasure hunters like Fred and Pete. So, what amazing treasures are in the box? The boys are surprised to find an old sheet with a funny picture of a skeleton on it. What could it mean? And who does it belong to? It’s off to the Museum of Cornish Treasures to see if Suzy and Archie have any clues. They reckon it’s something to do with ships and send Fred and Pete off to Charlestown Harbour. There they spot a large ship but are collared by the ship’s captain as they climb on board – not any old ship’s captain, but a pirate captain! Fred and Pete are thrilled to learn that their sheet is, in fact, a pirate flag - a Jolly Roger, used by pirates to warn other ships that they’re on their way to take their goods. programme.desc: Two teams touch down at the STARS space station to take on three scientific challenges to win out-of-this world prizes. First, they must decide whether objects will float or sink in a water tank. programme.desc: Diellza's family comes from Kosovo. She makes a traditional recipe of stuffed peppers. Diellza has lovely colourful ingredients for her stuffed peppers such as spring onions, sweetcorn, grated carrot. She also uses cooked rice, chopped tomatoes, parsley, garlic puree and paprika for seasoning. This yummy filling is stuffed into her peppers and placed in the oven to be cooked for her friends. To accompany her meal, Diellza serves her friends a traditional Kosovan drink made of yoghurt and water called kos. Will they enjoy her drink, and will they guess what the special ingredient is?

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Snowdon, or Yr Wyddfa, is the most popular mountain in Britain, attracting three-quarters of a million visitors each year - and it only getting busier. This documentary follows the work that goes in to keeping the tourists happy, including the maintenance of the five-mile mountain railway, which not only carries visitors but also supplies to the shop and cafe and even water and waste to and from the toilets. Meanwhile, wardens patrol the mountain to ensure the safety of walkers, and volunteers spends their weekends collecting tons of discarded rubbish

programme.title: Wrexham: Hollywood or Bust!
programme.desc: Wrexham AFC are one of the oldest football clubs in the world, with a home in the Racecourse Ground that dates back virtually to the dawn of the sport. Theirs is a history that stretches back further than most, with drama and memorable moments to rival any club. This documentary recounts that history, while revealing why promotion to the Football League under Hollywood-based owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney would mean so much to the club's fans

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Documentary following gay Christian couple Grace and Jess as they prepare to move into their first home together, a canal boat, leaving behind the family, friends and church community that refuse to accept them. They hope that once they are settled, they can find a new church and community that welcomes them

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts. Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the transformation of terraced houses in Abbey Wood, south-east London, and Carlisle, as well as a seven-year project on a large period house in Torquay

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning hosts, as experts Philip Serrell and Richard Madley help teams scouring the streets of Hungerford, Berkshire, pick up items to sell for profit at auction

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits St Barts in London, the UK's oldest hospital, to discover how it began as a monastery after a vision from God, and finds out how faith is still at work today. Plus, Laura Wright meets two sisters in Birmingham with a love of singing who were the first conjoined twins in the UK to undergo a life-saving procedure

programme.title: Pizza Boys
programme.desc: Jez and Ieuz's trip leads them to Naples, the spiritual home of pizza. It's a matter of days before the competition, so they need to focus on tracking down the best ingredients for their pizza. They're also keen to pick up any last minute tips, so they arrange a series of masterclasses with some of the most renowned pizzaiolos in the city

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Coverage of the men's road race on day four of the Championship, which consists of a 170-mile route from Edinburgh to Glasgow. Since Tom Simpson became the first in 1965, only one other Briton has claimed the coveted rainbow jersey in this event - Mark Cavendish in 2011. Rising Belgian star Remco Evenepoel took victory at last year's race, powering away from his rivals during the closing stages. France's Christophe Laporte secured silver, and Australian Michael Matthews took bronze

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A dog-friendly garden is a top priority today for Nicki Chapman's buyer in Devon, who has £350,000 to spend on a new home for her and her much-loved pet pooch

programme.title: Ghostbusters (1984)
programme.desc: Three eccentric scientists put their hi-tech gadgetry and knowledge of the paranormal to money-making use by setting up in business as freelance ghost catchers. A musician calls them in to investigate when she sees strange creatures in her kitchen, only to end up possessed. As the spook-hunting team members deal with an attempt to shut their operation down, they discover an evil demonic entity is being summoned into existence and it falls to them to stop this creature from destroying the world. Supernatural comedy adventure, starring Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, Sigourney Weaver, Ernie Hudson and Rick Moranis

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Charlotte Smith return to Dumfries House where the Summer activities are in full swing. Matt discovers how Dumfries House is providing local people with ways to improve mental and physical wellbeing and joins a tea dance. Charlotte visits a craft workshop to try her hand at stained glass window making, and hears about plans to re-use, refurbish and re-engineer turbines

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the grounds of Wollaton Hall in Nottingham, where treasures include a fire extinguisher cocktail shaker, a toy monkey popping out of a musical pineapple, and underwear belonging to Queen Victoria. Fiona also learns about local activist George Powe, who campaigned to secure employment opportunities for black workers at Raleigh in the 1950s, and guesses the value of three cameo items

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: Kasia takes on her first assignment as an agent - shadowing a Polish woman working in an aircraft factory in Manchester who is suspected of sending information to the Nazis. Rajib's military values are tested when he learns his men are receiving worse rations than their allies, and he is torn between duty and ideal. Meanwhile, a familiar face comes to David's aid

programme.title: The King's Speech (2010)
programme.desc: The younger son of George V struggles to cope with an uncontrollable stammer, prompting his wife to enlist the aid of an eccentric Australian speech therapist. The support and friendship of the doctor prove invaluable when a crisis places the repressed prince on the throne, just as the outbreak of the Second World War leaves the country in need of a strong king. Oscar-winning fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter and Guy Pearce

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: A series of burglaries allows police to crack county-lines drug-dealing conspiracy, a consumer complaint brings down a national SMS fraud and a jet-setting con-woman is brought to justice

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble meet the newest diva at the Park - Inny the giant otter, while Jean Johansson discovers why koalas can sometimes hamper Australian detectives. Plus, the Park is placed on red alert as one of the carnivores goes missing

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Jacqui Joseph follow the fortunes of a terrace in Aberdare, south Wales, a slice of land in Glasgow and an end terrace in Rochester, Kent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Shepton Mallet, Somerset, with the reds and the blue teams being guided by experts John Cameron and Stephanie Connell. During the contest, Natasha learns about the history of wristwatches, and checks out a seriously valuable collection

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: As the chef's Cornish odyssey nears its end, he takes a break in the city of Truro, where he discovers an unusual ghost story and tours the magnificent cathedral. He also meets a family passionate about offal, who prepare Rick a meal of pickled ox tongue and beef heart tacos, and in the county's most northerly parish he tells the story of an eccentric vicar who would retrieve the bodies from nearby shipwrecks and bury them in his church graveyard

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor is joined by Hairy Biker Si King on his quest to find new ways of spending time in the great outdoors. Taking the scenic route north to Chillingham, the pair head out to visit the estate's famous wild cattle

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a family with two children to find a home in Devon with a large garden, and discovers an approach to woodcraft that uses steam to sculpt interior design pieces

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Aspiring makers are given the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. With chronic fatigue syndrome, autism and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder Dea is hoping her willow-weaving can help her build a home business. For artistically inclined Gemma, it's all about proving her careers advisor wrong. Dom Chinea presents

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The Isle of Skye hosts Roo Irvine and Mark Hill, where a sweet bonbon dish and a collection of glass go to auction while a clan chieftain's secret weapon is revealed. As the last auction approaches, it remains to be seen whether Mark will win his debut trip - or whether Roo will manage to snatch victory at the last

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Lucy Porter joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a lively mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Snowdon, or Yr Wyddfa, is the most popular mountain in Britain, attracting three-quarters of a million visitors each year - and it only getting busier. This documentary follows the work that goes in to keeping the tourists happy, including the maintenance of the five-mile mountain railway, which not only carries visitors but also supplies to the shop and cafe and even water and waste to and from the toilets. Meanwhile, wardens patrol the mountain to ensure the safety of walkers, and volunteers spends their weekends collecting tons of discarded rubbish

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: British athletics great Roger Black, former Premier League midfielder Steve Sidwell, Paralympian-turned-broadcaster Ade Adepitan and Olympic gold medal-winning hockey player Alex Danson-Bennett join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining celebrities take part in their final challenge, for which they cook a two-course meal that will be judged not only by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also Celebrity MasterChef Champions Angellica Bell (2017) and Lisa Snowdon (2022) and 2022 finalist Danny Jones. The best will go through to the semi-final. The others will be hanging up their MasterChef aprons

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee goes to watch Benji playing football for a local under-13 team and is unable to restrain himself on the touchline and becomes the competitive dad that all other parents want to avoid. Undaunted by the disapproval of Toby, who coaches the team, Lee sets about rigging the vote for the player of the year. With a guest appearance from veteran actor Melvyn Hayes

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: The morning after the night before has not started well. Diane is worried that she did not impress the school governors, Kath is revealing more than she should to the women in the old people's home and Martin is desperately trying to get his hands on a chunk of cash

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Ready Player One (2018)
programme.desc: In 2045, gamers explore a virtual world in the quest for a deceased tycoon's fortune. However, they must also contend with an evil corporation who will stop at nothing to get their hands on the prize. Steven Spielberg's fantasy adventure based on Ernest Cline's novel, starring Tye Sheridan, Olivia Cooke, Ben Mendelsohn, Simon Pegg and Mark Rylance

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Switzerland v Spain (Kick-off 6.00am). Coverage of the opening last-16 match, which takes place at Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. The Swiss progressed to the knockout stage after topping Group A with a record of one win and two draws from their three matches, while Spain could only finish second in Group C despite winning twice and drawing once in their three games

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Switzerland v Spain (Kick-off 6.00am). Coverage of the opening last-16 match, which takes place at Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. The Swiss progressed to the knockout stage after topping Group A with a record of one win and two draws from their three matches, while Spain could only finish second in Group C despite winning twice and drawing once in their three games

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Cyrus Todiwala and Irina Georgescu, plus special guest Rob Rinder. Olly Smith picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya Bakes
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain shares some of her favourite recipes for biscuits and small bites to snack on. She kicks things off with her deceptively simple but extremely beautiful Italian-inspired amaretti biscuits, before demonstrating how to make deep-fried chicken doughnuts. Finally, Nadiya shares her recipe for chocolate-dipped florentines

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts explores a bungalow with a bizarre layout in Cannock, Staffordshire, and a three-bedroom semi with lots of space in Alsager, Cheshire. Martel Maxwell checks out a two-bedroom terrace in need of modernisation in Hartlepool, County Durham

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Live coverage of day three from Fort William, Scotland, featuring the mountain bike downhill finals. Five-time world champion Rachel Atherton will be hoping to recapture a title she last won in 2018, while fellow Briton Tahnee Seagrave has twice won silver medals in the event. Valentina Holl is the defending champion, having become the first Austrian downhill winner last year

programme.title: Sportscene Results
programme.desc: David Currie presents a round-up of the afternoon's main football news and results. Plus, a look back at the week's talking points

programme.title: Beechgrove Repotted
programme.desc: The work of two community gardening groups - the Easthaven Community, whose plan to make their village square mode attractive developed into an award-winning story of regeneration, and the Dunkeld vegetable growing initiative The Field, which now grows produce on a huge scale

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Competing to show-off their music knowledge are a mother and daughter-in-law from Bristol, two friends from Basingstoke and Camberley, and neighbours from Nottingham

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts as daytime TV stars Fern Britton, Owain Wyn Evans, Naga Munchetty, Charlie Stayt, Mr Motivator, Carol McGiffin, Diarmuid Gavin and Dr Punam Krishan try to win £50,000 for charity

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Harpz Kaur, Harriet Rose, John Middleton, Nicola Thorp, Aurie Styla, Chris Washington, Danny Clarke and Hannah Stitfall try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max returns to the ED to treat a mother and son involved in a car accident. He is thrown back into working alongside Jodie, while the patients' history brings back old memories. Paige is forced to face her feelings despite using work as a distraction, and Donna struggles to move on from her recent trauma

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: Beres, Aria and Vita travel to Jamaica for a family funeral, where the story of Aria's short-lived musical career comes to light - but Vita refuses to be scared off by her mother's bad experiences. Beres is furious to discover that he has been left nothing in the will, but his outburst leads Ara to a horrifying realisation about the man her husband claims is his younger brother

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Action from the opening fixtures of the season, including Celtic v Ross County at Celtic Park and Kilmarnock v Rangers at The BBSP Stadium Rugby Park

programme.title: When Harry Met Sally (1989)
programme.desc: A man and a woman with different attitudes to life meet by chance and develop a close and long-lasting friendship. But over time, a mutual sexual attraction begins to develop and threatens to ruin their relationship - raising the question whether men and women can ever really be just friends. Romantic comedy, starring Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan

programme.title: Eighth Grade (2018)
programme.desc: Introverted 13-year-old Kayla Day is finishing her final week at a New York public school. She posts motivational online videos on about confidence and self-image that get few views, Meanwhile, Mark, her single father, struggles to connect with her and break Kayla's reliance on social media. Writer/director Bo Burnham's critically acclaimed comedy drama, starring Elsie Fisher, Josh Hamilton and Emily Robinson

programme.desc: Netherlands v South Africa (Kick-off 3.00am). Coverage of the third last-16 match, which takes place at Sydney Football Stadium in Australia. programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a music-based quiz show in which contestants must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a £10,000 jackpot up for grabs. Competing to show-off their music knowledge are a mother and daughter-in-law from Bristol, two friends from Basingstoke and Camberley, and neighbours from Nottingham

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan hosts as daytime TV stars Fern Britton, Owain Wyn Evans, Naga Munchetty, Charlie Stayt, Mr Motivator, Carol McGiffin, Diarmuid Gavin and Dr Punam Krishan try to win £50,000 for charity

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Harpz Kaur, Harriet Rose, John Middleton, Nicola Thorp, Aurie Styla, Chris Washington, Danny Clarke and Hannah Stitfall try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max returns to the ED to treat a mother and son involved in a car accident. He is thrown back into working alongside Jodie, while the patients' history brings back old memories. Paige is forced to face her feelings despite using work as a distraction, and Donna struggles to move on from her recent trauma

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: Beres, Aria and Vita travel to Jamaica for a family funeral, where the story of Aria's short-lived musical career comes to light - but Vita refuses to be scared off by her mother's bad experiences. Beres is furious to discover that he has been left nothing in the will, but his outburst leads Ara to a horrifying realisation about the man her husband claims is his younger brother

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: When Harry Met Sally (1989)
programme.desc: A man and a woman with different attitudes to life meet by chance and develop a close and long-lasting friendship. But over time, a mutual sexual attraction begins to develop and threatens to ruin their relationship - raising the question whether men and women can ever really be just friends. Romantic comedy, starring Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan

programme.title: Eighth Grade (2018)
programme.desc: Introverted 13-year-old Kayla Day is finishing her final week at a New York public school. She posts motivational online videos on about confidence and self-image that get few views, Meanwhile, Mark, her single father, struggles to connect with her and break Kayla's reliance on social media. Writer/director Bo Burnham's critically acclaimed comedy drama, starring Elsie Fisher, Josh Hamilton and Emily Robinson

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Netherlands v South Africa (Kick-off 3.00am). Coverage of the third last-16 match, which takes place at Sydney Football Stadium in Australia. The Dutch topped Group E after claiming victories over Portugal and Vietnam, either side of a draw against reigning champions USA, while South Africa progressed to the knockout stage after one win, one draw and one loss in Group G, against Italy, Argentina and Sweden, respectively

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Documentary following gay Christian couple Grace and Jess as they prepare to move into their first home together, a canal boat, leaving behind the family, friends and church community that refuse to accept them. They hope that once they are settled, they can find a new church and community that welcomes them

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts. Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the transformation of terraced houses in Abbey Wood, south-east London, and Carlisle, as well as a seven-year project on a large period house in Torquay

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning hosts, as experts Philip Serrell and Richard Madley help teams scouring the streets of Hungerford, Berkshire, pick up items to sell for profit at auction

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher visits St Barts in London, the UK's oldest hospital, to discover how it began as a monastery after a vision from God, and finds out how faith is still at work today. Plus, Laura Wright meets two sisters in Birmingham with a love of singing who were the first conjoined twins in the UK to undergo a life-saving procedure

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore enlists Daniel Heath to give new life to a retro bureau picked up from Woking Recycling Centre. For her own project, Sarah has three wooden doors to get creative with

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Coverage of the men's road race on day four of the Championship, which consists of a 170-mile route from Edinburgh to Glasgow. Since Tom Simpson became the first in 1965, only one other Briton has claimed the coveted rainbow jersey in this event - Mark Cavendish in 2011. Rising Belgian star Remco Evenepoel took victory at last year's race, powering away from his rivals during the closing stages. France's Christophe Laporte secured silver, and Australian Michael Matthews took bronze

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A dog-friendly garden is a top priority today for Nicki Chapman's buyer in Devon, who has £350,000 to spend on a new home for her and her much-loved pet pooch

programme.title: Ghostbusters (1984)
programme.desc: Three eccentric scientists put their hi-tech gadgetry and knowledge of the paranormal to money-making use by setting up in business as freelance ghost catchers. A musician calls them in to investigate when she sees strange creatures in her kitchen, only to end up possessed. As the spook-hunting team members deal with an attempt to shut their operation down, they discover an evil demonic entity is being summoned into existence and it falls to them to stop this creature from destroying the world. Supernatural comedy adventure, starring Bill Murray, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, Sigourney Weaver, Ernie Hudson and Rick Moranis

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Charlotte Smith return to Dumfries House where the Summer activities are in full swing. Matt discovers how Dumfries House is providing local people with ways to improve mental and physical wellbeing and joins a tea dance. Charlotte visits a craft workshop to try her hand at stained glass window making, and hears about plans to re-use, refurbish and re-engineer turbines

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the grounds of Wollaton Hall in Nottingham, where treasures include a fire extinguisher cocktail shaker, a toy monkey popping out of a musical pineapple, and underwear belonging to Queen Victoria. Fiona also learns about local activist George Powe, who campaigned to secure employment opportunities for black workers at Raleigh in the 1950s, and guesses the value of three cameo items

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: Kasia takes on her first assignment as an agent - shadowing a Polish woman working in an aircraft factory in Manchester who is suspected of sending information to the Nazis. Rajib's military values are tested when he learns his men are receiving worse rations than their allies, and he is torn between duty and ideal. Meanwhile, a familiar face comes to David's aid

programme.title: The King's Speech (2010)
programme.desc: The younger son of George V struggles to cope with an uncontrollable stammer, prompting his wife to enlist the aid of an eccentric Australian speech therapist. The support and friendship of the doctor prove invaluable when a crisis places the repressed prince on the throne, just as the outbreak of the Second World War leaves the country in need of a strong king. Oscar-winning fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter and Guy Pearce

programme.title: Take Me to the Opera
programme.desc: Zeinab Badawi meets Sir Bryn Terfel, one of the most distinguished singers of our age. A star who is in demand on stages across the world, Bryn has stayed true to his Welsh roots and is a great proponent for Welsh culture. He invites Zeinab behind the scenes not only at the Royal Opera House where he is a regular performer, but also in his native Wales where he still lives and where he is recording an album of traditional folk songs. He was chosen personally by King Charles to sing at his coronation. Zeinab visits the Welsh National Opera which launched Bryn's international career and speaks to WNO general director, Aidan Lang who oversaw his debut performance. The WNO's touring wardrobe manager Judith Russell, shows Zeinab Sir Bryn's costume as Falstaff in the opera by Verdi and explains how she was tasked with dressing him for this iconic role. We meet young Welsh singers performing at the same local singing competitions that Bryn sang in as a young boy and ask how he inspires them t

programme.title: Take Me to the Opera
programme.desc: Zeinab Badawi meets Sir Bryn Terfel, one of the most distinguished singers of our age. A star who is in demand on stages across the world, Bryn has stayed true to his Welsh roots and is a great proponent for Welsh culture. He invites Zeinab behind the scenes not only at the Royal Opera House where he is a regular performer, but also in his native Wales where he still lives and where he is recording an album of traditional folk songs. He was chosen personally by King Charles to sing at his coronation. Zeinab visits the Welsh National Opera which launched Bryn's international career and speaks to WNO general director, Aidan Lang who oversaw his debut performance. The WNO's touring wardrobe manager Judith Russell, shows Zeinab Sir Bryn's costume as Falstaff in the opera by Verdi and explains how she was tasked with dressing him for this iconic role. We meet young Welsh singers performing at the same local singing competitions that Bryn sang in as a young boy and ask how he inspires them t

programme.title: NY2SY
programme.desc: In a focused and candid delivery, Niall Iain Macdonald recounts his adventure story, attempting to conquer the might of the Atlantic Ocean in a solo rowing boat. Supported by footage taken over several years, both ashore and at sea, he shares the dramatic highs and the extreme lows of his 2018 adventure. In the lead-up to his latest attempt he records his slow, steady progress, the cancellations, postponements, accidents and frustrations that met him along the way, and also the sheer elation of finally setting out to sea. Illustrated with unique footage captured on board as he rowed

With analysis from Jason Weaver and Leonna Mayor, reports by Luke Harvey, Mark Heyes, Charlotte Hawkins, Rishi Persad and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Mark Johnson

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Ric, Gemma, Cameron and Michele work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Amelia is unable to face her father after his guilty plea. Nate threatens to tell Cain everything about Caleb's business. Gabby has to cover her awkwardness with Billy

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Jenny fears that diminishing trade could lead to the pub's closure, Gemma lies to Chesney about her new job, Alya gives Stu relationship advice, and Paul humours Bernie's rituals

programme.title: Riches
programme.desc: Alesha, Gus and Wanda finally get Stephen's safe open, though Alesha is baffled by what she finds. Together with Simon, Nina confronts Oyin about her revelation in Zurich

programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at autumn in the northern hemisphere and spring in the south, seasons of change that bring opportunities, but also huge challenges. By September temperatures in northern Canada can plummet as low as -20C, but there is one stretch of river that still flows and bears are able to fish for the final salmon of the season. In southern Africa the rains have been gone for many months and watering holes have all-but dried up, while a king penguin chick on Marion Island answers the call of the ocean

programme.title: Karen Carney's Leaders of the Pack
programme.desc: Karen meets the five-time African Women's Footballer of the Year Asisat Oshoala, who has given girls the chance to chase their dreams through her foundation in Lagos, Nigeria

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Collision
programme.desc: Hard-hitting action from AEW's newest show, featuring stars including CM Punk, FTR, The House of Black, Thunder Rosa, Miro, and more

Lloyd, PB and Abacus discover a fly frozen in an ice cube - a drop from the kitchen counter later allows them to meet Marvin, a fly from the past. programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd discovers that Abacus and PB have been invited to a party without him... and to make matters worse, it's Berry's party! Not wanting to be outdone by Berry, Lloyd decides that he will have his own party... and it will be much better and more popular than Berry's.

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons

programme.title: Mystery Lane
programme.desc: Animated series about a young guinea pig and her little brother, who look to solve police investigations. One cat who managed to escape speaks of a sort of giant ant that spurts liquid on cats to immobilise them before carrying them off.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Japan v Norway (Kick-off 9.00am). Coverage of the second last-16 match at Wellington Regional Stadium in New Zealand. programme.title: GoldenEye (1995)
programme.desc: James Bond heads for Russia to investigate the connection between the theft of an experimental helicopter and an orbital satellite weapon with the power to devastate entire cities. He discovers both have fallen into the hands of a mysterious criminal mastermind with a grudge against Britain and a connection with 007's past. Spy adventure, with Pierce Brosnan taking on his first assignment as 007. Sean Bean, Izabella Scorupco and Famke Janssen also star. Directed by Martin Campbell, who later helmed Daniel Craig's first outing as Bond, Casino Royale

programme.title: Moneyball
programme.desc: Ian Wright hosts as three more teams of two try to bank money by dropping a ball from the Launcher onto an amount of cash. Couple Ryan and Penelope hope to take a once-in-a-lifetime trip to Las Vegas, Simone and Philip want to hit the big money so they can take their family to Jamaica, while if brothers Patrick and Dominic scoop the cash they will jet off to Japan

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as Melvin Odoom, Carl Fogarty, Louis Smith and Bonnie Langford pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: Irvine Welsh's Crime
