programme.desc: The friends are excited about going on a camping trip, but Zip is nervous about being in a dark place away from home. Can he overcome his fears?

programme.title: Daisy & Ollie
programme.desc: Daisy and Ollie find out where wild animals go during the wintertime when temperatures get lower and become frigid

programme.title: Milkshake! Bop Box Boogie
programme.desc: Specially composed and choreographed songs involving lots of jumping, with the presenters teaching the audience the moves and then encouraging them to dance along with them

programme.title: Sunny Bunnies
programme.desc: Turbo, Hopper, Boo, Iris and Shiny compete against each other to overcome the most difficult obstacle course ever known

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: Karai realises the seriousness of the alien threat after witnessing the Kraang in action, and proposes an alliance with the Turtles

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Part two of two. Rachel tries to fix up Monica with action-movie star Jean-Claude Van Damme, but ends up landing a date with him herself. Meanwhile, Chandler gets his comeuppance for a high-school prank he played on a former classmate. Guest starring Julia Roberts

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey gives Chandler a hideous bracelet as a sign of their friendship, while Rachel insists she has no time for Ross - until Monica's old prom video helps her see him in a different light. Comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston, Courteney Cox and David Schwimmer

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica's parents are dismayed to discover she is dating their middle-aged friend, and an argument with Chandler prompts Joey to move out of the flat. Matthew Perry and Matt LeBlanc star, with guest appearances by Tom Selleck and Elliott Gould

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel begins to feel smothered by Ross's constant attention. Meanwhile, Phoebe makes a video for her song Smellycat, and Chandler's new flatmate Eddie causes problems

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jacko is shot at by a suspect with a gun and armed police have fractions of a second in order to decide whether to return fire as pellets fly past their ears in the pitch black. Multiple units box in a suspect taxi that is ferrying cocaine and cannabis along the A1, while Spike and the bike team hunt for a man spotted on a quad bike with a gun

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Liam and Ben attempt to catch a gang of late-night burglars, but one of the suspects treats an officer to a face full of saliva, while Jacko and Simon are in pursuit of a car round the streets of Ferryhill, but it's not the interceptors who make the arrest. Meanwhile, Spike tails two suspected burglars in an unmarked car before making a back-street stop and Liam's sniffer dog Louie uncovers large amounts of cash and drugs following an armed raid

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: It is March 2022 and the Tower staff are continuing work on their most ambitious installation ever - the transformation of the moat into a huge floral display to celebrate the Queen's Platinum Jubilee. Known as Superbloom, the installation has been three years in the planning

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: It's April 2022, and there are five weeks to go until Superbloom, the Tower's transformation of its historic moat into a vast floral installation to celebrate the Platinum Jubilee, is due to open to the public. However, one of the UK's driest springs has wreaked havoc on the 20 million flower seeds sown in the moat for the display - the ones that have germinated are weeks behind and large areas are still bare

programme.title: 10 Ways the Victorians Changed Britain
programme.desc: Michael Buerk narrates a documentary looking at landmark concepts and structures from the Victorian era that transformed the nation, examining sewers, bridges and trains, including London's underground. The programme also looks at advancements in hospitals and surgery, the ships that changed trading pathways for ever, and holidays

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Dorset: Country and Coast
programme.desc: At Weymouth beach, Mark Anderson puts the finishing touches to his latest sculpture made entirely of sand, a Coronation scene featuring King Charles complete with crown. Cameras also follow oyster farmer Charlie Bloxham at Fleet Lagoon, who supplies oysters to his father Nigel's popular seafood restaurant

programme.title: TK Maxx: How Do They Really Do It?
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the department store, revealing how they keep their products so cheap and make people buy more. Contributors include Grace Dent and Harry Wallop, TK Maxx buyers, store managers, consumer writers and super-fans

programme.title: Million Pound Motorhomes
programme.desc: Faced with a summer travelling to various DJing gigs across the country, fashion stylist and motorhoming novice Gok Wan tries out a luxury vehicle for the day. He's not a fan of the countryside, but fortunately older brother and campervan owner Kwoklyn has joined him for a little moral support. Could Gok become a convert?

programme.title: Coastguard: Search & Rescue SOS
programme.desc: An around-the-UK rowing boat challenge goes disastrously wrong off the Mull of Kintyre as horrendous weather puts five rowers' lives in jeopardy. The search and rescue Helicopter crew at Prestwick are tasked with locating and saving the stranded and isolated competitors in the pitch black, as the boat edges closer to an area of treacherous rocks

programme.title: Police: Hour of Duty
programme.desc: The return after a break of the documentary following Derbyshire police on duty between 9pm and 10pm. After a two-day manhunt, officers finally track down a man suspected of carrying out a series of terrifying armed robberies, but they face a race against time to secure the evidence needed to charge him

programme.title: Police Code Zero: Officer Under Attack
programme.desc: On Anglesey, PC Mark Lee fights for his life after a driver deliberately runs him down and leaves him for dead, while a Wiltshire officer tries to persuade a violent man to hand over his distressed baby. In Liverpool, a terrified officer issues an urgent call for help while hanging out of the passenger side of his own police car - the result of a criminal in handcuffs stealing trying to use it as a getaway vehicle

programme.title: Surgeons: A Matter of Life or Death
programme.desc: Pratyush prepares himself for what he hopes will be a life-changing surgery for a fast-growing tumour pressing on his brain stem, threatening his hearing and making it difficult for him to walk. If surgeons don't operate soon, his tumour could potentially push him into a coma, before ultimately killing him. Cameras also focus on Mariella, who needs a ground-breaking procedure for a recurring bowel cancer

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Great British Ships
programme.desc: Rob Bell tells the dramatic story of Second World War aircraft carrier HMS Ark Royal, which hunted down some of Nazi Germany's most feared warships

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Peter Wright gets an emergency call from sheep farmer Clive, whose ewe has gone into labour, but the lambs are tangled up inside their mother. One arrives safely but the second isn't breathing, and Peter's skills are put to the test when he realises there is a third lamb still to come. In Boroughbridge, Julian and Anne operate on a dog with a tumour in its chest

programme.title: Britain's Great Cathedrals with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: Liverpool cathedral is the Church of England's newest cathedral, and the largest in Britain. It was designed in the Gothic style by Giles Gilbert Scott, who also designed the red telephone box. It took 74 years to build and was paid for by money donated from the people of Liverpool. National tragedies such as the sinking of the Titanic - many of whose crew came from Liverpool - and the Hillsborough football disaster are remembered within its walls. It is also where Paul McCartney composed and performed his first classical piece of music, the Liverpool Oratorio

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Sweetie hijacks the cloaked Air Patroller and steals the royal throne of Barkingburg

programme.title: Monsters vs Aliens (2009)
programme.desc: A woman is exposed to radiation from a meteorite that causes her to grow to an enormous size during her wedding. She is captured by the military and held prisoner with an assortment of strange creatures - but when aliens invade, these freaks of nature are the only ones capable of saving the world. Animated sci-fi comedy, with the voices of Reese Witherspoon and Hugh Laurie

programme.title: The Spiderwick Chronicles (2008)
programme.desc: Life for identical twins Jared and Simon and their sister Mallory begins afresh when their mother inherits a spooky mansion. But after moving in, strange things begin to happen, and as the youngsters investigate, they discover a book that opens up a mysterious world of amazing supernatural creatures. Fantasy adventure, starring Freddie Highmore in a dual role alongside Sarah Bolger and Nick Nolte

programme.title: The Ghost and Mrs Muir (1947)
programme.desc: A lonely widow moves into a seaside cottage, despite rumours that it is haunted. Sure enough, she finds herself sharing her home with the spirit of a dead sea captain - but his efforts to scare her away prove unsuccessful, and instead a growing attraction develops between the pair as she agrees to write his biography. Romantic fantasy, starring Gene Tierney, Rex Harrison and George Sanders

programme.title: Mysterious Island (1961)
programme.desc: Soldiers escaping the American Civil War take flight in a giant observation balloon and land far away on a strange uncharted island, where they encounter giant creatures, cut-throat pirates, two shipwrecked Englishwomen - and the mysterious Captain Nemo. Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Michael Craig, Herbert Lom, Joan Greenwood and Michael Callan, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Congo (1995)
programme.desc: An expedition to find King Solomon's diamond mines in the jungles of the Congo disappears without trace. The tycoon behind the mission sends his assistant, a former CIA agent, to find out what became of the explorers - only to discover that the party met a grisly fate at the hands of a horde of vicious apes. Action adventure based on Michael Crichton's novel, with Dylan Walsh, Laura Linney, Tim Curry and Grant Heslov

programme.title: Predator (1987)
programme.desc: An elite military team takes on a top-secret mission in the jungles of Central America, but the soldiers realise they have been deceived by their CIA employers. A greater danger presents itself when they are stalked by a lethal alien big-game hunter with the power to become invisible, that has come to Earth to stalk human prey. Sci-fi thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Carl Weathers and Bill Duke

programme.title: Crawl (2019)
programme.desc: When her Florida home town is devastated by a hurricane, Haley heads back into danger to search for her missing father. The pair find themselves trapped in a rapidly flooding house, but the rising waters might be the least of their worries. Horror thriller, starring Kaya Scodelario and Barry Pepper

programme.title: Animal Kingdom (2010)
programme.desc: A teenager goes to live with his grandmother after his mother's death from a drug overdose, only to find his new guardian is the head of a criminal gang. He must decide where his loyalties lie when his unstable uncle leads the family into increasingly violent actions, while a police detective tries to persuade him to turn informant. Crime thriller, with James Frecheville, Guy Pearce, Jacki Weaver and Ben Mendelsohn

programme.title: Carry On Constable (1960)
programme.desc: A flu epidemic leaves a police station short of staff, forcing a desperate inspector to send four bungling trainees on the beat. The inept would-be bobbies manage to increase the crime rate even before they have started work, and their long-suffering sergeant faces an uphill battle to whip them into shape. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Kenneth Connor, Charles Hawtrey and Joan Sims

programme.title: Muppets from Space (1999)
programme.desc: Gonzo hits the road with pal Rizzo in tow and goes in search of his roots - only to make the amazing discovery that his parents belonged to a race of aliens. He then has to choose whether to board a UFO and return to his family, or stay with the friends he knows and loves. Family comedy, with F Murray Abraham, David Arquette, Ray Liotta, Andie MacDowell and Rob Schneider alongside the puppets

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon (2010)
programme.desc: A clumsy Viking boy longs to become a mighty dragon slayer and protect his village from the fearsome flying lizards, but his father thinks he is not up to the task. However, when he sets out to prove his worth, he ends up befriending a dragon, and realises his people may have misjudged the creatures. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Jay Baruchel and Gerard Butler

programme.title: The Italian Job (1969)
programme.desc: A crook assembles a motley gang to steal £4million in gold bullion from an Italian armoured car, which brings Turin to a standstill and enables the robbers to make a quick getaway in a fleet of Minis - but they end up falling foul of the Mafia along the way. Crime comedy, starring Michael Caine, Noel Coward, Benny Hill, Tony Beckley and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: Oppenheimer Interview Special
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy, Matt Damon, Emily Blunt and director Christopher Nolan talk about making the historical dramatic thriller about J. Robert Oppenheimer

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow (2004)
programme.desc: A climatologist warns global warming will soon result in destructive freak weather, or even another ice age. He thinks the world still has time to prepare for the worst, but the crisis happens almost immediately - and as storms, earthquakes and hurricanes strike in terrifying fashion, he races across America to rescue his son from a frozen New York. Disaster thriller, with Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid

programme.title: Infinite (2021)
programme.desc: A man who finds himself troubled by memories that are not his and developing skills he never learned is recruited by a mysterious organisation. The members of this group have learned to access the experiences of their past lives, but one has gone rogue, and must be stopped in his efforts to end the cycle of reincarnation by destroying all human life. Sci-fi thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Spontaneous (2020)
programme.desc: When students in their high school begin to explode inexplicably, a group of seniors begin to adjust to a world where each moment could be their last. Writer/director Brian Duffield's black comedy, based on a novel by Aaron Starmer, starring Katherine Langford, Charlie Plummer and Yvonne Orji

programme.title: The Nightingale (2018)
programme.desc: In 19th-century Australia, Irish convict Clare serves a cruel and unforgiving master, Lieutenant Hawkins, who refuses her request to leave. Hawkins punishes Clare's insolence with horrific sexual violence that almost breaks her spirit. Drama, starring Aisling Franciosi and Sam Claflin

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania (2012)
programme.desc: Dracula opens a luxury resort for monsters, to provide a refuge from terrified humans. His cosy sanctuary is disrupted when a normal man unwittingly checks in, and the situation is complicated when the unwanted guest takes a liking to the count's daughter. Animated comedy, with the voices of Adam Sandler and Andy Samberg

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 2 (2015)
programme.desc: Dracula is worried that his half-human grandson is not showing any vampiric tendencies, so enlists the help of his fellow monsters in showing the youngster how it is done. The count is shocked to receive an unwelcome visit from his own father, who does not approve of his son's tolerance of humans. Animated comedy, with the voices of Adam Sandler and Andy Samberg

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 3: A Monster Vacation (2018)
programme.desc: Count Dracula and company participate in a cruise for sea-loving monsters, unaware that their boat is being commandeered by the monster-hating Van Helsing family. Animated sequel, featuring the voices of Adam Sandler, Andy Samberg and Selena Gomez

programme.title: Rat Race (2001)
programme.desc: A casino magnate approaches a group of no-hopers with the offer of $2million to whoever retrieves the sum from a locker in a train station in New Mexico, prompting a madcap cross-continent dash. Meanwhile, the casino owner's high-rolling gambler friends place bets on which of the bumbling contestants will win. Comedy, with Rowan Atkinson, John Cleese, Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Bates, Seth Green and Cuba Gooding Jr

programme.title: A Good Year (2006)
programme.desc: A city trader inherits a French vineyard from his deceased uncle. But when he goes to France to get a valuation on his newly acquired property so he can sell it, a series of unexpected events leads him to reassess his priorities in life. Ridley Scott's comedy drama based on Peter Mayle's novel, starring Russell Crowe, Albert Finney, Abbie Cornish and Marion Cotillard

programme.title: 12 Strong (2018)
programme.desc: The story of the first Special Forces team deployed to Afghanistan after 9/11. Under the leadership of a new captain, the team must work with an Afghan warlord to take down the Taliban. War drama, based on Doug Stanton's non-fiction book Horse Soldiers, starring Chris Hemsworth, Michael Shannon and Michael Pena

programme.title: Underwater (2020)
programme.desc: Nora Price is a mechanical engineer at the Kepler drilling station, seven miles beneath the surface of the Pacific Ocean. She and a small crew fight for survival after a tremor causes catastrophic failures to the base's integrity. Meanwhile, in the inky void, something unspeakable lurks, waiting to attack. Sci-fi thriller, starring Kristen Stewart, Mamoudou Athie and Vincent Cassell

programme.title: The Shape of Water (2017)
programme.desc: Elisa Esposito is a mute singleton who lives above a cinema. Although friends with Giles, a neighbouring artist, she lives a lonely existence. While he has designs on the cafe worker nearby, Elisa cleans up at top-secret government lab, a bus ride away in Baltimore, Maryland. One day in 1962, she makes a life-changing discovery when Elisa finds an amphibious humanoid creature who is being held captive, and they embark on an extraordinary relationship. Guillermo del Toro's Oscar and Bafta-winning fantasy, starring Sally Hawkins, Michael Shannon, Octavia Spencer and Doug Jones

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Joel gives Leela an ultimatum, Scott and Maxine clash as he fails to understand her predicament, and Warren worries that Felix is hiding things from her

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Pearl gives her daughter some sage advice on Warren. Meanwhile, Donna Marie struggles with her health, and Felix stands up for Mercedes

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Beaver, Pennsylvania, where he meets a brother-and-sister team who find it almost impossible to work together. Their relationship is so fractured that they're failing to save their father's Italian restaurant Levanti's from being overwhelmed by local competition, and the situation has become so desperate that their dad is in danger of losing his life savings

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Sam's Mediterranean Kabob Room in Monrovia, California, and within minutes of his arrival, is caught in the crossfire of an argument between the owner, his wife and their children, all of whom are feeling the pressure of working seven days a week. Can the chef save the business and mend the warring family's frayed relationships?

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Missy asks some uncomfortable questions at church, while Meemaw and Georgie go into business together. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Meemaw helps Dale take care of his ex-wife June after she suffers a knee injury, while Sheldon takes his first engineering class with the no-nonsense Professor Boucher

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: When Jake's favourite pizzeria burns down, the fire marshal (Patton Oswalt) believes the owner should be the prime suspect in the investigation. Outraged, the detective does everything in his power to prove him wrong, even if it means stepping outside his jurisdiction. Meanwhile, chaos ensues at the precinct after a computer virus publishes everyone's internet browser history

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Santiago hosts a Thanksgiving dinner at her apartment for all her colleagues, but the event risks turning into a disaster, especially when Holt and Peralta have to leave in a hurry to catch a thief who has stolen a large sum of money from the evidence lock-up. Can Boyle save the day?

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil fears the worst when he misses a call informing him of the results of a routine medical, while Manny's day out with Jay is going well until he is whisked away for a belated birthday treat at the horse races. American comedy, starring Ty Burrell and Ed O'Neill

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Claire help Manny and Luke with a school project - building capsules that would best protect an egg in a two-storey drop. Meanwhile, Phil enlists the help of Haley and Gloria as he prepares for a major real-estate presentation, while Mitch and Cameron use the power of song to impress prospective birth mothers. American comedy, starring Julie Bowen and Ed O'Neill

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon goes to great lengths to convince Amy that they should have a baby together after they successfully complete a scientific experiment using their DNA samples. Raj is too embarrassed to tell his friends what the new woman in his life does for a living

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon cannot contain his jealousy when he hears that his university colleague Bert has won a prestigious fellowship with an impressive grant. Elsewhere, Howard finds an old remote-controlled toy he made in the past, but the rest of the group do not seemed to be too impressed by it. Stephen Hawking guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy tries to help Sheldon get over his desire for closure when one of his favourite TV shows is cancelled on a cliffhanger ending. Raj discovers his new girlfriend Lucy has a blog in which she has written about him, and is upset when he learns she believes he has feminine qualities, causing him to worry about their relationship

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon discover their favourite childhood TV science show host Professor Proton can be booked for private parties and decide to hire him to entertain them. Meanwhile, Raj asks Howard and Bernadette to look after his dog for the weekend, but the couple panic when the canine goes missing. Guest starring Bob Newhart

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Dave earns Calvin's respect when he thwarts a robbery at the barbershop, until the recognition goes to his head and he starts exaggerating the truth

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When Victor Alvarez, owner of Motor Boys, tries to steal Calvin's customers, the Butlers and Johnsons join forces on a plan to drum up business and give back to their community

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Andre persuades Phil to make a spontaneous purchase when the friends go car shopping, and Jay is determined to take Gloria and Manny to his high-school reunion. Desperate to impress their fellow B&B owners, the pair host a Hawaiian barbecue, before pulling out all the stops at breakfast time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Owners Tim and Amelia Whitaker welcome their guests to their non-star-rated boutique accommodation, Nearwater, on the south Cornish coast, and take them out on a boat for a spot of seal watching and diving. However, the sight of wet suits proves too much for one contestant, and tensions also flare over dinner when Mike and Danny are quizzed about their relationship

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Eva Buschmann hosts the competition at the Roundhouse Hotel in Weymouth, Dorset. She makes the mistake of assuming Danny Robinson and Mike Gibson are a couple, and offers them a double room with an exposed shower, but hopes a lesson in abstract art and a meal at her favourite harbour-side restaurant will win the other contestants over

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mike Gibson and Danny Robinson host their rival B&B owners at their four-star guesthouse - Homecliffe Hotel in Blackpool. The hosts take their visitors on a tram ride along the seafront and on to Madame Tussauds, but there are complaints about uncomfortable mattresses and disappointing views and the next day's breakfast fails to impress

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and air their grievances. Watersedge hosts Alan and Sylvie start the proceedings, but confront the guests who complained about their room having no en-suite facilities, before the winner is announced

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: In the first challenge, the remaining teams are tasked with creating 24 reimagined millefeuille and 24 pavlovas in never-before-seen ways. The showpiece display must feature two batches of 24 modern religieuse, designed to look like musical icons

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition visits the Nottingham and Derby area. American Hali kicks proceeding off with a travel-inspired menu, including Moroccan chicken cigars and an unusual dessert combination. With a very gregarious gathering of guests, the food plays second fiddle to a fun night of impressions, dance moves and kitchen chaos

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition continues in the Nottingham and Derby area. Car salesman Alistair hopes to step the competition up a gear. However, after narrowly avoiding an argument last night with Lesley, the veteran of the group, he's treading on thin ice. And he's serving up a bizarre menu, including chilli soup - for dessert - and prunes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Nottingham, fun-loving funeral arranger Kim hosts an evening packed with games galore and a mixed bag menu. Fifty-seven-year-old Lesley is again the butt of car salesman Alistair's geriatric jibes and takes great delight in watching him put on the spot during a dance-off

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Customer relations associate and part-time drag queen Adam plans a theatrical night of flamboyance as the culinary competition continues in the Derby and Nottingham area. Can he get his guests begging for an encore, will Alastair and Lesley ever kiss and make up and what will Adam's guests think of his secret hobby as a ufologist?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final soiree in the Nottingham and Derby area sees 57-year-old Lesley counting on a night of glamour and glitz - plus some good home-cooked food - to secure the £1,000 prize. However, before any food is even dished up, the guests make a surprising discovery about the host

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: Alan and Val McCoy put their life savings on the line to make their dream of living on water come true, entrusting a boat builder to make them their dream narrow boat floating home. The couple have been together for 11 years and now that they're retired, they've decided that owning a narrow boat could be a unique way to be near their families - all of whom live along the canal system across the Midlands and northwest England

programme.title: Bettany Hughes' Treasures of the World
programme.desc: The host travels to Saudi Arabia and Jordan, and visits the iconic sites and undiscovered jewels that are only just becoming accessible to tourists. From the natural beauty of the Red Sea, with its outstanding corals and marine life, to the ancient rock art and desert camps of local Bedouin tribes, testament to humanity's connection to this awe-inspiring landscape over millennia

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Ninety-three-year-old Ernest is brought in with life-threatening injuries after being knocked down by a hit-and-run driver just outside the hospital. He goes into cardiac arrest, and a consultant must keep his heart going manually in a bid to save his life. Meanwhile, an 83-year-old's finger is mangled by a machine at his metal-working business, and a 51-year-old man with learning difficulties is treated after collapsing, prompting his elderly mother to wonder how he will eventually cope after her death

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Consultant Emer Sutherland helps treat an eight-year-old who has fallen 8ft onto concrete while riding his BMX, losing his front teeth and possibly injuring his head and spine. A 19-year-old motorcyclist who hit a bollard requires urgent treatment on his leg, which may otherwise need to be amputated, and X-rays of a stabbing victim yield startling results

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan teaming up against Noel Fielding and Fay Ripley. The Brett Domino Trio are in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

Holly Walsh joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Ninety-three-year-old Ernest is brought in with life-threatening injuries after being knocked down by a hit-and-run driver just outside the hospital. He goes into cardiac arrest, and a consultant must keep his heart going manually in a bid to save his life. Meanwhile, an 83-year-old's finger is mangled by a machine at his metal-working business, and a 51-year-old man with learning difficulties is treated after collapsing, prompting his elderly mother to wonder how he will eventually cope after her death

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces

The Italian road trip takes in a holiday lodge made almost entirely from glass in the Dolomites

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: Sheffield architects Howard Evans and Prue Chiles set out to transform Mandy's 1980s redbrick house, which stands out like a sore thumb among the grand Victorian properties it sits alongside on Nottingham's prestigious Park Estate. The duo are familiar with unlocking the potential of buildings, but this could be their biggest challenge yet

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George gets to celebrate one of his favourite periods of British architecture when he helps out at an arts and crafts Edwardian terrace house in Addiscombe, south London. Cookie and Sophia bought their home six months ago, but, despite it being full to the brim with amazing original features, from fireplaces to balustrades and stained-glass windows, it needed some serious TLC. This renovation is a labour of love as the couple set about painstakingly restoring the features by themselves. George visits the wallpaper library of his all-time design hero William Morris, and tries his hand at block printing

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This competition takes place in and around Liverpool, where the first to host is 41-year-old taxi business owner Rob, who plans a Scouse themed evening. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is night two in Liverpool, and the turn of businesswoman Sam to try and impress with her South-African-themed evening, though her food is a bit hit and miss

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gym worker Toria hosts the third party in Liverpool, and hopes a kissing game around the dinner table, along with her flaky flapjacks, will be enough to secure the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Undergraduate Inzy is the fourth host in Liverpool, and he is on a mission to prove students really can cook. The flirting between him and Toria continues, but will he allow love to stand in way of the competition?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Liverpool, property developer Christine plans to wow her guests with a Spanish holiday-themed dinner party. However, the mood is rather more feisty than fiesta as on-going tensions finally come to a head and it's not long before the honesty - and the sparks - begin to fly

programme.title: Four in a Bed

After searching for truffles in the surrounding area, guest Tony Horton's passion for the royal family causes him to clash with fellow competitor Shaun Baggs, whose mood is worsened by the discovery of bugs in his bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition continues at Le Manoir in the Dordogne, owned by royalist Tony Horton and his Armenian wife Shou Shou - who make a poor first impression by presenting guests with a timetable specifying when they are allowed to use the bathroom. A vinegar-tasting session also receives a tepid response, and some of the visitors are bemused by their hosts turning up for breakfast in costume

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Wine-loving Shaun Baggs and his partner Patrick Weaver bring the contest to Le Clos Rabelais in central France, where they invite fellow competitors to take part in a traditional French dance class. programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The second Bournemouth host is aristocratic vet Sir Henry, who plans to charm his way to the prize by hosting an evening of relaxed dining

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Bournemouth, spiritual student Simone hopes to wow her guests with a spicy Bajan menu. She's keen to impress her new friend, posh vet Sir Henry, but she's unsure about Pippa, who doesn't hold back as she probes Simone about her student house

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

In the port of Monterey, he discovers the city's Spanish and Mexican heritage, before heading to Paso de Robles, where he tours Hearst Castle, dream home of the newspaper baron, William Randolph Hearst. In the hills of Morro Bay, Michael joins avocado farmer, Jim Shanley, amid his 4,000 avocado trees to harvest the pears and learn how to make guacamole. Arriving in Los Angeles, Michael heads for the Warner Brothers studio, founded on Sunset Boulevard

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his tour of Los Angeles, joining the locals for Mexican Independence Day, and discovering the secrets of backyard oil drilling in a county that is home to the largest urban oil field in the US. Moving on to Laguna Beach, he learns how artists from the east coast travelled west on the Transcontinental Railroad to found a colony of painters attracted by the beautiful coastline and glorious light to paint outside

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston, learning how surgery was first made bearable in 1846 by a miraculous new substance. In Salem, he gets a taste of the witch hunts and the hysteria that gripped the town in the 17th century, before visiting the former home of Little Women author Louisa May Alcott in Concord

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads for Plymouth, where he learns about the indigenous tribes of Wampanoag people, before boarding the Cape Cod Central heritage bound for Hyannis. Finally, he makes his way to the island of Nantucket, where he discovers how New Englanders made vast fortunes from whale oil, before heading to join conservationists and whale watchers at sea

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's rail voyage continues through Connecticut heading north through the scenic New England states. In New Haven, a crash course in rowing takes place on a stretch of water where college teams from Yale and Harvard have battled for victory since 1852. Making tracks north to Vermont, Michael experiences 19th-century rural farm life, when its green pastures made it the butter capital of the world

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: In Montreal, Michael Portillo discovers how French and British colonial roots have influenced the city's construction, cuisine and culture. Undaunted by his guidebook's description of the treacherous Lachine Rapids, the one-time MP gets a thorough soaking on a white-knuckle boat ride down the St. Lawrence River. In the Canadian capital, Ottawa, Michael visits the country's parliament to hear about the birth of the new nation after Confederation in 1867. And at Ottawa's historic Central Experimental Farm, Michael hears of the pioneering discoveries, which launched a Canadian wheat boom

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary examining how Hitler and the Nazi party rose to power in Germany during the 1930s, revealing the greed, manipulation and frightening underestimation of Adolf Hitler's ambition. In 1930, Germany was a liberal democracy, with elections, parliament and the rule of law, but just four years later its leader was a dictator and its government is in the hands of murderers. Leading historians and experts take viewers inside the minds of those hellbent on gaining power and those who tried to stop them

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Factors influencing America's decision to support Britain during the Second World War, and how Hitler's declaration of war on the US convinced Congress to take more decisive action. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The battle for North Africa, which involved three years of fighting between Rommel's Afrika Korps and Montgomery's Desert Rats and culminated in the Allied victory at El Alamein. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey around north-west England in the elegant resort town of Southport, where the railways provided thousands of holidaymakers with the chance enjoy the fun of the fair. On his journey around some of the region's larger towns, the presenter uncovers the history of Victorian entrepreneurship in Wigan and the beginnings of the Industrial Revolution in Bolton, before heading to smaller Leyland to get behind the wheel of a 100-year-old commercial vehicle

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey around north-west England by celebrating Victorian trade with the Preston Guild, and then heading to Rochdale to learn about a pioneering movement to improve the lives of working families. The presenter also follows in the tracks of many 19th-century industrial employees who made day trips to Hebden Bridge to walk in the Calder Valley

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses into West Yorkshire to begin the next leg of his journey, visiting the Worth Valley and the home of the three Bronte sisters, who were early investors in the railway industry. He then heads to Oakworth to find out how its station and tracks were used in one of the most popular films ever made, and in Bradford discovers the ways in which 19th-century workers saved to buy a home. The presenter finishes in Halifax, where he learns how the railways contributed to the town's success

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo tunes into the music of the mills and collieries of Victorian England by joining a brass band in Honley, West Yorkshire, before stopping off in Holmfirth to learn about a tragedy that led to a tourist boom in the town. The presenter then crosses into Derbyshire to pay homage to railway engineer George Stephenson at his resting place in Chesterfield, before concluding his journey at Chatsworth House, which was one of the first stately homes to welcome visitors by rail

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey to Leeds, beginning at London's Euston station. He finds out what happened to the once proud Euston Arch and heads to Camden to see how goods were transported by rail, road and canal. He reflects on the Harrow rail disaster of 1952 and visits a country estate in Tring, Hertfordshire, before alighting at Cheddington in Buckinghamshire, which is close to the scene of 1963's Great Train Robbery

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey to Leeds by travelling through Buckinghamshire, meeting one of the Second World War's most secret agents at Bletchley. In Olney, he learns about a poet whose words are still sung today, and explores the first purpose-built railway town at Wolverton. His last stop is Newport Pagnell, where he tackles the ancient craft of vellum-making

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The next part of Michael Portillo's journey from London to Leeds begins in Northampton, where Victorian methods have been used to make shoes for more than 130 years. The ex-politician then heads to Warwickshire, learning about the legacy of Dr Thomas Arnold at Rugby School and finding out how Coventry's craftsmen learned to adapt to survive, before ending this leg of his trip in Nuneaton

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the next stage of his journey to Leeds, Michael Portillo sets off in Leicester, where he finds out about the hunt for Richard III's remains. The zoo also has four rare new arrivals called tenrecs, mysterious mammals from Madagascar and, with so little known about them, the keepers try everything they can to help them breed, while red river hog Mali has given birth to twins, but tearaway dad Confetti is a threat to his own babies

programme.desc: Michelle is torn between a new friend and Conrad. Assistant District Attorney Katie Rayburn is reluctantly enlisted to pursue possible charges against Michelle. Starring Elle Fanning, Colton Ryan and Chloe Sevigny

programme.title: The Girl from Plainville
programme.desc: Gail and David hire a lawyer to represent their daughter as the threat of legal action mounts, while Co and Lynn struggle with their pasts and Michelle tries to help Coco settle into a new normal

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who has been stabbed in the leg and the head, only to discover he had already overdosed on heroin prior to receiving his injuries. Paramedics also treat a man struggling to breathe after a triple heart bypass operation, a woman whose rare genetic condition causes her to have seizures, and a man with severe chest pains who has recently had treatment for a heart complaint

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first destination of the week is the Horseshoe Hotel in Egton Bridge, North Yorkshire, where a fancy machine causes confusion but breakfast and eco toiletries prove a big hit

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B battle continues in Market Bosworth at the Dixie Arms, run by Alex, whose blingy beds impress two of the guests. However, not all of the facilities are quite as successful

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Bradbury's of Blackpool, where former flight attendant Matt is hoping to change his guests' perceptions of the seaside town

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Little Oakhurst, in Stonyhurst near Clitheroe, run by husband-and-wife team Andy and Joanne. The guests are immediately captivated by the stunning location, with views over the Lancashire countryside, though the optional and additional breakfast brings some mixed reviews. At feedback time, it becomes clear that glamping isn't for everyone

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Payment Day sees Craig and Greta keen to get to the bottom of facilities faults, before Alex points the finger at them about some unsavoury feedback scores. Matt wants to question Alex's cleanliness comments, and Joanne and Andy have some beef over their breakfast scores

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at The Peniarth Arms in Bryncrug, where host Susanne Fox is joined by her best friend and colleague Anwen Roberts, but a revelation raises some eyebrows

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Toby Rhys Davies is second to host at Apple Camping in Redberth, Pembrokeshire, where he hopes his unique take on glamping will impress his rivals. The UFO and aeroplane accommodation prove a hit with the guests - but come feedback time, there's just something missing

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Garden House in Blagdon, Somerset, where host and chef Ryan Blackman is hoping his breakfast will wow his guests. But when morning comes around, Susanne and Anwen find their brekkie hard to stomach

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guest house owners head to Ivy House in St Austell, Cornwall, home to James Earl. Susanne and Anwen marvel at the delightful views, but the lack of a lock is a key issue for Ryan and Sarah. At breakfast, Toby's PJs are on the menu but it's the sausage that's under scrutiny for Susanne and Anwen

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guest house owners meet one last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. Ryan and Sarah seem rather upset over cleanliness concerns and James wants to chew over some tough breakfast feedback. Some strong opinions are aired, and differences debated before the payments are revealed and a winner is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Ceri and Mike Green both work for the Lincolnshire Fire Service, but with retirement approaching, they want to move to the mountains. Ceri feels a strong pull towards the Lake District, where they spent their honeymoon, but Mike dreams of living in the French Alps, where he's been on skiing holidays with friends. Jonnie Irwin shows them three properties in the UK for their budget of £435,000, while Laura Hamilton shows them three in the Alps for their £415,000 French budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Newly married Brian and Wendy Woods from Somerset are looking to buy their dream home on the beautiful island of Tenerife. Brian has been holidaying in the canaries for over 30 years, and since he met Wendy 10 years ago the couple have been dreaming about relocating to their favourite island permanently. Armed with a budget of £180,000 Laura Hamilton locates five properties from them to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lian and Dave are searching for a holiday home in Spain's Almería Province to enjoy with their 13-year-old son Dominic. Ben Hillman lines up five impressive properties for their £80,000 budget, but will any of them be the perfect place?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Nick and Natalie Hammond are selling their family home in Hertfordshire and want to buy somewhere near the coast with more outdoor space for their four children. Nick's keen on a move to Mallorca, having holidayed in Spain as a child, but Natalie would prefer to move to Cornwall. They have a cash budget of £275,000 if they buy in Majorca where Laura Hamilton is on hand to help, or £375,000 if they buy in Cornwall, where Jonnie Irwin tries to beat Laura's properties

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Danni Menzies arrives in the beautiful coastal town of Nerja in southern Spain to meet house-hunter Frances, who is dreaming of buying a holiday home she can enjoy with her friends and family. With her daughter Karina also on hand to lend her support, Frances would love to find a two-bed property close to the sea, so Danni sets out to deliver her dream within a budget of £200,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps a couple find their dream holiday home in Benalmadena on the Spanish Costa del Sol. Samar and Pap have a budget of £220,000 and are looking for a place for their large extended family to stay on their vacations

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary set inside Woodgreen animal charity. Londoners Roshni and Jay meet two very different dogs - Bella the confident, playful Staffie, and Cech the shy but cuddly terrier. Bella seems to warm to Jay, but it's Roshni who has the final say. Olivia the blind spaniel is looking for a home and funeral workers Amy and Alex want to rescue a dog in need

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Memorable moments of the year, featuring some of the country's favourite celebrities critiquing TV shows that they have watched. The line-up of famous faces includes Clare Balding and Alice Arnold, Gyles Brandreth and Maureen Lipman, Lorraine Kelly and her daughter Rosie, Nick Grimshaw and his niece Liv, Mo Gilligan and Babatunde Aleshe, Tom Jones and Anne-Marie, and Shaun Ryder and Bez. Shows appraised include Masked Dancer, First Dates, Quizness, The Handmaid's Tale, Secret Crush, Extreme Sisters, Sex/Life and Celebrity Karaoke Club

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who has been stabbed in the leg and the head, only to discover he had already overdosed on heroin prior to receiving his injuries. Paramedics also treat a man struggling to breathe after a triple heart bypass operation, a woman whose rare genetic condition causes her to have seizures, and a man with severe chest pains who has recently had treatment for a heart complaint

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: Wilderness survival challenge in which 11 people must battle the elements in the remote wilderness of northwest Canada, equipped with only a handful of basic tools to win £100,000. At the start of the journey, they face the first signs of bears and wolves, and race to put up shelters and light fires before the sun sets, leaving them in the pitch-black night with only the sounds of the wilderness for company

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: At Queen's Medical Centre in Nottingham, one of the busiest A&E departments in Europe, 77-year-old Keith is treated for a cardiac arrest and Joanna has a spinal fracture after falling from her horse. In the Urgent Treatment Unit, 79-year-old John is being patched up after being run over by a car at his local market

programme.title: Sky Coppers
programme.desc: The unit hunt for a group of kids trying to set fire to a shed in an allotment. An infrared drone kit is used to search for a teenager who hasn't been seen since climbing a scaffolding around a nightclub in Birmingham. Plus, the night-time search for a burglar breaking into a house with a suspected cannabis crop

programme.title: Levison Wood: Walking With
programme.desc: The explorer tracks down some of the most endangered animals on the planet in their natural habitats, starting with orangutans in the rainforests of Borneo. Deforestation and poaching have halved the apes' population in the last 60 years, and they're in serious danger of becoming extinct. In the company of indigenous guides and naturalists, he gets a better understanding of how they are surviving against worsening odds caused by the increasing threat of human activity and climate change.

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc: The trainers give advice to Melissa, whose labrador-cross Milo is running rings around her and makes a dash for it every time she calls his name. Two-year old zuchon Archie is aggressive to strangers and has begun to bite, and mother and daughter owners Kirsty and Katie are desperate to end hiss reign of terror before it gets any worse

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers close in on a suspected stolen car near Tadcaster, but they have to deploy two stingers as the driver tries to escape by hitting speeds in excess of 100mph. programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series focuses on Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. programme.title: UBOS
programme.desc: The children learn Zarlak has cast an evil spell to steal all the laughter from the world, so they venture to the underworld kingdom of Umbra to foil his plans

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Skysurfer Strike Force
programme.desc: Jack Holister is an extraordinary skydiver who leads a group of vigilante crime fighters known as the Skysurfer Strike Force. who must try to seek out and defeat the robotic Cybron

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance.

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: Harvey continues to come to terms with life after returning home from the RAF

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: Former football professional Harvey endeavours to rebuild his chaotic life. Comedy starring Kenneth Cranham

programme.title: Clive James
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Clive and his cardboard suitcase arrived in London. Decades later, he reassesses the city he knew then and explores the city he finds now.

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and travel enthusiast Griff Rhys Jones boards the trains of Australia to explore Down Under, covering thousands of miles from surfers' beaches to dusty outback. On the first leg he journeys from Perth to Kalgoorlie on board the Indian Pacific, discovering Western Australia's riches, and asking - what is a sandgroper?

programme.title: Emmeline Pankhurst: The Making of a Militant
programme.desc: Profile of Emmeline Pankhurst, who led an army of women onto the streets of Britain as leader of the suffragettes. Actress Sally Lindsay takes a look at the personal loves, losses and political passions that transformed this working mother from Manchester into a militant activist campaigning for votes for women

programme.title: Tiger in the Smoke (1956)
programme.desc: A criminal gang made up of war veterans is forced by a murderous escaped convict to go in search of hidden treasure. Crime thriller, starring Donald Sinden and Muriel Pavlow

programme.title: The Trap (1966)
programme.desc: A woman is sold to a trapper in 19th-century British Columbia and reluctantly becomes his wife, overcoming her initial fears to nurse him through an illness. Drama, starring Oliver Reed, Rita Tushingham and Rex Sevenoaks

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and travel enthusiast Griff Rhys Jones boards the trains of Australia to explore Down Under, covering thousands of miles from surfers' beaches to dusty outback. On the first leg he journeys from Perth to Kalgoorlie on board the Indian Pacific, discovering Western Australia's riches, and asking - what is a sandgroper?

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: Pigsy is hailed as the new King and God of the Kingdom of the Red Hog, but Tripitaka discovers the current ruler is a demon and Monkey sets out with Sandy to stop him and save Princess Green Lotus

programme.title: Auschwitz in 33 Objects
programme.desc: Discover the stories behind the personal items and belongings left behind in Auschwitz Birkenau, a former nazi concentration and extermination camp, the world's largest cemetery and resting place. Part one of five

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert sets out again to explore some of Britain's finest habitats and most spectacular wildlife, beginning in Scotland's Caledonian pine forests, home to rare species including the capercaillie. Ray camps out in the hope of catching the turkey-sized grouse's courtship display, and also goes in search of the red squirrel

programme.title: Triple Cross (1966)
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War spy adventure about Eddie Chapman, a bank robber who became a British double agent in exchange for money and a full pardon. Following the German invasion of Jersey, Chapman offers to provide information to the Nazis, who are unaware his loyalties really lie with the British Secret Service. With Christopher Plummer, Trevor Howard, Yul Brynner, Romy Schneider and Claudine Auger

programme.title: Hound (2017)
programme.desc: An alcoholic loner is snapped out of his misery when his faithful dog is murdered by a local gangster. Overcoming his addiction, he transforms his life by mastering martial arts, then puts his skills to use seeking vengeance. Crime thriller, starring Sacharissa Claxton and Neal Ward

programme.title: Hitler's Bodyguard
programme.desc: How the Stauffenberg bomb missed Hitler by inches. Documentary investigating how the German leader managed to escape assassination several times thanks to his handpicked bodyguards

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours for locals and tourists, exploring Elephant & Castle and Croydon. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Brixton and Harmondsworth for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Crystal Palace and Shoreditch. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: London's Weekend
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend.

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: A look inside Ireland's first purpose-built clinic that caters exclusively for cats, nestled in the leafy environs of Glanmire outside Cork city. In this first episode, veterinary surgeon Clare Meade and her team meet the families of the cats they treat to try to understand their ailments. Biker Wolfgang worries that Paulina, the newest arrival to his feline family of 25, is having extreme difficulty breathing, Clare diagnoses a large growth in Paulina's throat and it looks like she will need to operate

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: Emmeline Pankhurst: The Making of a Militant
programme.desc: Profile of Emmeline Pankhurst, who led an army of women onto the streets of Britain as leader of the suffragettes. Actress Sally Lindsay takes a look at the personal loves, losses and political passions that transformed this working mother from Manchester into a militant activist campaigning for votes for women

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: A beleaguered Harvey faces more personal crises. Comedy, starring Kenneth Cranham

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: With Christmas approaching, Harvey is anxious to get Stanley a bike and works long hours as a department store Santa to get the money

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: A look inside Ireland's first purpose-built clinic that caters exclusively for cats, nestled in the leafy environs of Glanmire outside Cork city. In this first episode, veterinary surgeon Clare Meade and her team meet the families of the cats they treat to try to understand their ailments. Biker Wolfgang worries that Paulina, the newest arrival to his feline family of 25, is having extreme difficulty breathing, Clare diagnoses a large growth in Paulina's throat and it looks like she will need to operate

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert sets out again to explore some of Britain's finest habitats and most spectacular wildlife, beginning in Scotland's Caledonian pine forests, home to rare species including the capercaillie. Ray camps out in the hope of catching the turkey-sized grouse's courtship display, and also goes in search of the red squirrel

programme.title: The Passing of the Third Floor Back (1935)
programme.desc: A mysterious Christ-like stranger arrives at a boarding house in London, and changes the residents' lives forever. Drama, starring Conrad Veidt, Rene Ray, Anna Lee and Frank Cellier

programme.title: Frieda (1947)
programme.desc: An RAF officer returns home after the Second World War, having broken out of a prisoner of war camp. He brings with him his new wife - a German woman who helped him escape. However, family and friends struggle to accept the marriage - especially when her brother comes to visit. Drama based on Ronald Millar's stage play, starring Mai Zetterling and David Farrar

programme.title: Sabotage (1936)
programme.desc: An undercover detective poses as a grocer to get closer to a suspected terrorist thought to be plotting to blow up London. Alfred Hitchcock's thriller based on Joseph Conrad's The Secret Agent, starring Oscar Homolka, Sylvia Sidney, John Loder, Desmond Tester and Joyce Barbour

programme.title: A Canterbury Tale (1944)
programme.desc: A land girl, an Army sergeant and a GI meet in a small Kent village during the Second World War and set out to unmask the mystery assailant conducting an unusual reign of terror against local women. Powell and Pressburger's mystery, starring Eric Portman, Sheila Sim, John Sweet, Esmond Knight and Dennis Price

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: The Lion Queen
programme.desc: Glen Garriff Lion Reserve faces disaster after disaster. A fire burns out of control on a neighbouring farm and threatens to spread to Glen Garriff, where a vital piece of firefighting equipment is out of action

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes: Hands of a Murderer (1990)
programme.desc: The sleuth pursues his arch-enemy Moriarty, who has escaped the gallows and is plotting to steal top-secret information from British intelligence. When Holmes foils his scheme, Moriarty kidnaps the detective's spymaster brother with the intention of forcing him to reveal all his secrets. Detective drama, starring Edward Woodward, John Hillerman and Anthony Andrews

programme.title: An Englishman in New York
programme.desc: John Hurt reprises his role as Quentin Crisp in this sequel to The Naked Civil Servant, picking up his story where the 1975 drama about the eccentric Englishman left off. Crisp sets off on the journey of a lifetime to the Big Apple, where the Americans immediately embrace the openly gay writer and his waspish ways, and before long he is being wined and dined by celebrities in every corner of Manhattan. But, as is so often the case with Quentin, he cannot resist making outrageous comments, and an ill-considered quip about the growing Aids crisis sees him suddenly dropped from high society. Sex and the City's Cynthia Nixon co-stars as performance artist Penny Arcade, with Jonathan Tucker, Denis O'Hare and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: Her Private Hell (1968)
programme.desc: An Italian woman comes to London to seek her fortune, but is seduced into a seedy world of nude modelling. Drama, starring Lucia Modugno and Terence Skelton

programme.title: Small City (2021)
programme.desc: A young street hustler from London and a drugs mule from Europe form an unlikely bond after a violent confrontation. Thriller, starring Eddie Thompson and Isabella Nefar

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: Fern, a beautiful blue Burmese and one of the Cat Hospital's oldest patients takes a turn for the worse. Franklin, a prize-winning Maine coon, a novice when it comes to females meets Ruby - but will romance ensue? Veterinary specialist Clare Meade meets a visiting cat called Honey

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: David Attenborough's Light on Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough embarks on a search for the lights of nature, on a journey that will lead to ocean depths, claustrophobic caves and forests by night

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: This special extended episode shows what goes into the production of London's newest electric taxi

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton begins at Loch Hourn on the mainland, before travelling to Skye, the tiny island of Soay and finishing on Canna. Along the way, he visits the house that was the inspiration for James Bond's home Skyfall, embarks on a nerve-racking caving expedition under the summit of Blaven

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: For the final leg of his journey, Paul Murton heads to the northern Shetland islands of Fetlar, Unst and Yell, which were once part of Norway. Along the way, he meets the members of a male vocal group who came together to celebrate their Norse heritage, gets a close view of wild otters, and fulfils a longheld ambition to visit Out Stack, the rocky outcrop that is the northernmost point of the British Isles

programme.title: Tiger in the Smoke (1956)
programme.desc: A criminal gang made up of war veterans is forced by a murderous escaped convict to go in search of hidden treasure. Crime thriller, starring Donald Sinden and Muriel Pavlow

programme.desc: A mysterious Christ-like stranger arrives at a boarding house in London, and changes the residents' lives forever. Drama, starring Conrad Veidt, Rene Ray, Anna Lee and Frank Cellier

programme.title: They Were Sisters (1945)
programme.desc: Three sisters marry men of very different character, and face different challenges as their married lives unfold. One remains happy but childless, another suffers cruelty at the hands of her sadistic husband, and the third has a series of affairs to cope with her loveless home life. Drama, with Phyllis Calvert and James Mason

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: The Tabernacle Choir from Temple Square, Music and the Spoken Word, providing music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's top ten choirs featuring regular guest artists.

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The Alphans come into contact with an alien craft, and Maya persuades the crew to help release the prisoner it is carrying. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: The duo infiltrate an organisation for geniuses, and discover their fellow members are being brainwashed by a sinister matron into committing audacious crimes. Light-hearted drama, starring Diana Rigg and Patrick Macnee

programme.title: When Missing Turns to Murder
programme.desc: The story of Helen McCourt, whose family's lives forever changed when her missing persons case turned into a murder investigation. Her body was never found

programme.title: Hound (2017)
programme.desc: An alcoholic loner is snapped out of his misery when his faithful dog is murdered by a local gangster. Overcoming his addiction, he transforms his life by mastering martial arts, then puts his skills to use seeking vengeance. Crime thriller, starring Sacharissa Claxton and Neal Ward

programme.title: Car Trouble (1986)
programme.desc: A sexually unsatisfied woman realises her husband's beloved new car means more to him than her. She has a fling with a salesman that accidentally results in the destruction of the precious vehicle, and consumed by rage, the husband plans a murderous revenge. Comedy, starring Julie Walters, Ian Charleson and Stratford Johns

programme.title: Realm of the Damned (2017)
programme.desc: A lone hero must survive in a world overrun by the supernatural forces of darkness. Animated horror, featuring the voice of David Vincent, Dani Filth and Jill Janus

programme.title: Strike It Lucky
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore hosts the madcap game show, in which three teams of two prove seek to progress along a board game-style path by answering questions. Each duo are allowed to determine how many spaces they would like to move by answering the corresponding number of questions. Landing on a space reveals it's hidden contents, which could amount to a prize, or a 'hot spot', which causes contestants to forfeit their gathered winnings
